text: As POLICE FLOOD THE PLAZA, the DRIVER turns to the PASSEN
(in Ukrainian) - Wake up the Americans. - The Passenger turns to the back where four BLACK-CLAD YOU MEN SIT, WAITING. The nearest one seems to be SLEEPING...

Hey - EYES CLOSED, the young man COCKS his weapon, chambering a round, POPS it out of the slide, CATCHES it, opens his ey this is THE PROTAGONIST... The Passenger nods, ‘okay’. The Driver looks down at a VARIETY OF UNIFORM PATCHES... SIRENS. The Americans shoulder WEAPONS, pull on HELMETS.. A UKRAINIAN SWAT VAN SCREECHES to a halt outside the thea The Passenger spots its markings - TOSSES the correspondi patches to the Americans, who slap them onto their should Ukrainian SWATs pour out of the SWAT van - The Americans JUMP out of the back of their van, SLIPPING UNNOTICED INTO THE STREAM OF SWATS pouring into the lobby
SWATs mass at each entrance... the Protagonist watches GA CANISTERS brought in TO THE AIR-CONDITIONING SYSTEM. The SWATs pull on GAS MASKS...
A WELL-DRESSED MAN sitting next to a UNIFORMED OFFICIAL l down into the stalls - people SLUMP, UNCONSCIOUS, IN A WAVE...  He turns to the Official - who motions calm, draws a SIDEARM...
A Terrorist wets a rag in a drinking fountain, ties it ar his nose and mouth. Others have WORKMAN’S RESPIRATORS AND FACE MASKS. They COCK THEIR WEAPONS, preparing...
THE SWATS BREACH - POURING into the theatre - exchange GUNFIRE with the TERRORISTS...

RUNNING. Fast but silent... FOLLOW the four Americans - they hit a junction - hand signals - they SPLIT two ways - FOLLOW two of them - one of them PEELS OFF up a staircase FOLLOW the last, the Protagonist - checking each box... INT. BOX, CONCERT HALL —- CONTINUOUS The Protagonist BURSTS in - takes out the Official beside Well-Dressed Man -
We live in a twilight world... The Well-Dressed Man stares, shocked -—
We live in a twilight world...
(focuses ) And there are no friends at dusk.
You’ve been made. This siege is a blind for them to vanish you.
But I’ve established contact -
Bring you in or kill you - I have two minutes. Make up your mind. The Well-Dressed Man nods, climbs to his feet...
Where’s the package?
Coat check. He hands the Protagonist a numbered ticket.

The battle between SWATs and Terrorists rages... SWATS mo down the corridor, checking the boxes one by one... INT. BOX, CONCERT HALL —- CONTINUOUS The Protagonist SMASHES the glass - checks the drop to th stalls, pulls out a black rope, ties it to a column... As they DROP, Terrorist gunfire rings out - they LAND - hiding amongst the UNCONSCIOUS AUDIENCE. The Well-Dressed takes a seat, FEIGNS SLEEP - the Protagonist ROLLS under seats — BLAM! Terrorists near the stage open fire - SHOTS ring ou hitting two sleeping audience members, nearby - the Well- Dressed Man TWITCHES - the Protagonist holds his ankle - urging him to keep still - BLAM! A third sleeping audience member is shot - the Protagonist jumps up, DRAWING THE TERRORISTS’ fire away f the Well-Dressed Man - The Protagonist races towards two REAL UKRAINIAN SWATS wh cover him from the Terrorists - one of them goes down. The Protagonist takes cover beside the real UKRAINIAN SWA WHO IS PLANTING A BOMB UNDER THE SEATS... he gestures to dead SWAT’s pack... the Protagonist unzips the bag to fin BOMB, COUNTING DOWN IN SYNC WITH THE OTHER BOMB —
(in Ukrainian, impatient) - What’re you doing? - The Ukrainian SWAT uses his gun to PROD the Velcro patch the Protagonist’s shoulder. It FALLS OFF...
(in Ukrainian) - Who are you? - The Protagonist is at a loss... BAM! The Ukrainian SWAT i taken out by another ‘SWAT’ -  ‘SWAT’ No friends at dusk, huh?
You'll do. The Protagonist GRABS the bombs, points at the Well-Dress Man -

(to the ‘SWAT’) Get him to the rally point. The ‘SWAT’ leads the Well-Dressed Man down a fire exit - INT. LOBBY, CONCERT HALL —- CONTINUOUS The Protagonist RACES across the lobby, gunfire RINGING O LEAPS over the counter into the COAT-CHECK AREA... Landing on the floor next to an unconscious coat-check gi He spots another bomb - ‘4:23’, ‘4:22’... the Protagonist checks the number on the coat-check ticket and efficientl moves across numbered racks until he finds a SPORTS BAG. He unzips it to find a BLACK METALLIC OBJECT the size of softball. He stuffs it into his pack and SCRAMBLES over the counter
- the Protagonist RUNS, checking numbers on doors... he S at a door, THROWS it open, JUMPS in low -
THREE ‘SWATS’, guns trained, and the Well-Dressed Man. Th Protagonist throws a bomb to SWAT 2, then shows the OBJEC the Well-Dressed Man -
I’ve never seen encapsulation like this.
We don’t know how old it is. It’s the real deal.
Did you have an out?
Service tunnels to sewers.
Swap clothes. The ‘SWAT’ and the Well-Dressed Man start changing. The Protagonist hands SWAT 3 the object -
Take this, take him, take his exit. I don’t trust ours any more. (to SWAT 2) Can you defuse it?
(shakes head) Centrally synchronized. Are there more? The Protagonist nods, STUFFS the bomb in his pack -
Covering their tracks.
Taking out the audience?
Just the cheap seats.
Not our mission -
Mine, now. The newly dressed ‘TARGET’ steps up -— ‘TARGET’ I’m with you - the Ukrainians are expecting a passenger.

The Protagonist and the ‘Target’ race through the SLEEPIN AUDIENCE COLLECTING BOMBS - the TIMERS tick down - ‘1:58’ 1:57". Crouched at a bomb, the Protagonist notices a BULLET HOLE the side of the chair - a TINY WHIFF OF SMOKE GATHERING.. CLICK - a gun is to his head - he spins around to see a SWAT. 0:34’, ‘0:33’... The ‘Target’ has his own gun on th SWAT - A STAND-OFF - all around them, UNCONSCIOUS CIVILIANS...

Walk away - you don’t need to kill these people.  6. The Protagonist turns back to the bomb... ‘0:32’, ‘0:31’. the bullet hole the PUFF OF SMOKE THICKENS... the Protagonist, confused, REACHES towards it... the SWAT COC his weapon... BLAM! With EXPLOSIVE FORCE THE BULLET HOLE DISAPPEARS - A NICK HAS APPEARED IN THE PROTAGONIST’S UNIFORM - he SPINS the SWAT is SHOT THROUGH THE CHEST AND DROPS... revealing FIGURE, also in a gas mask and tactical gear... The Figure TURNS - the Protagonist sees, on the Figure’s pack, a small TALISMAN - a COIN with a hole tied to a zip ORANGE AND YELLOW THREAD - the Protagonist turns back to the bomb - ‘TARGET’ That wasn’t one of us.
I’ll take the help. The Protagonist GRABS the last bomb: ‘0:03’... he looks u the boxes, where REAL SWATS EVACUATE THE HIGH OFFICIALS.. THE PROTAGONIST LOBS THE BOMBS UP INTO THE BOXES...
The Protagonist and ‘Target’ emerge - an EXPLOSION above
INNOCENT CIVILIANS STIR under the EXPLOSION IN THE BOXES

The van PULLS UP - rear door open - they JUMP INSIDE - INT. VAN —- MOMENTS LATER The Protagonist pulls off his mask. BREATHING. The Passen turns - grabs the ‘Target’s face, SOMETHING WRONG... the Protagonist turns to the Driver - WHO HAS A GUN POINTED A HIM ...
SCREAMING. The Protagonist’s screaming. Close on his eyes FLICKERING, SWEATING, PLEADING, DEFIANT... and we are -
The Protagonist, tied to a chair, in a windswept rail yar In front of him, the ‘Target’, also tied to a chair, back us. The Driver steps back, SWEATING. BLOODY PLIERS in han
(breathless) A man can be trained to hold out for about eighteen hours. The Driver gestures at a CLOCK on a table -
So your colleagues will clear by 7. The Driver PUSHES the ‘Target’s chair over. The ‘Target’ lands hard on his side on the gravel. Groaning.
He didn’t last eighteen minutes. The Driver pulls out a KNIFE. Leans in to the Protagonist
But he didn’t have anything to hide. You were smuggling a nobody. The knife moves towards the Protagonist’s throat...
Risky. ...then to his collar - which he CUTS -
Or were you counting on this? ..-pulling out a SILVER CAPSULE. The Protagonist stares.
Death, CIA issue. The Driver TOSSES the pill, WAVES the pliers at the clock

Spare yourself once they’re clear. The Protagonist looks at the clock - ‘5:38’. A FREIGHT TR RUMBLES PAST, CLOSE... As we close in on the clock, THE PROTAGONIST’S SCREAMS ARE DROWNED OUT BY THE FREIGHT TRAI The Driver steps back. The Protagonist breathes heavy, bl dribbling... the Driver follows his gaze to the clock - 6:53’ - then checks his watch. Frowns theatrically, picks the clock, SHAKES it -

Running fast... The Driver SETS THE HANDS BACK ONE HOUR. The Protagonist watches, DESPAIRING... as the Driver puts the clock back the table, the Protagonist notices the ‘Target’s FINGERS WIGGLING... in them is a SILVER PILL... Freight trains rumble past in opposite directions, sound BUILDING... The Driver approaches, bloody pliers in hand
We were alone.

I didn’t ask. Which means we're finally getting somewhere. The Protagonist HURLS himself onto the ‘Target’s hands - SMASHING - gets the PILL into his mouth - BITES DOWN - DEAFENING TRAIN NOISE... Arms GRAB at him - HANDS PRY his jaw as he SEIZES, MOUTH FOAMING... the Protagonist’s EYES GLAZE and we -
Black screen. Supertitle:
on face The Protagonist opens his eyes. A man stands beside his b SWAYING gently. This is FAY.
Welcome to the afterlife. The Protagonist lifts his head and we are -
The Protagonist sees the STEELY OCEAN SWELL...
You've been in a medically induced coma while we got you out of Ukraine and rebuilt your mouth.
The pills are fake?
We swapped yours for a sedative.
Why?
A test. The Protagonist runs a finger around his mouth. REALIZING
Test? They pulled my teeth out. Fay lets that dissipate. The Protagonist closes his eyes.
Did the team get clear?
No. Private Russians, we think.
Somebody talked.
Not you. You chose to die instead of giving up your colleagues.
The Protagonist stands in the wind, contemplating the horizon.
We all believe we’d run into the burning building, but until we feel that heat... we can never know. You do.
I resign.
You don’t work for us - you’re dead. The Protagonist turns to Fay, confused.
Your duty transcends national interests. This is about survival.
Whose?
Everyone's. There’s a cold war. Cold as ice. To even know its true nature is to lose. (MORE)

This is knowledge divided - all I have for you is a gesture -— (interlaces his fingers) - in combination with a word - ‘tenet’. Use it carefully, it’ll open the right doors, but some of the wrong ones, too.
That’s all they’ve told you?
The test you passed? (beat) Not everybody does. Fay breaks eye contact with the Protagonist. The boat continues to nose into the swell.

The Protagonist is driven away from the boat on a launch, towards the GIANT WHITE TURBINES of the ocean wind farm. The launch SLIPS amongst them, seeking the ladder of a particular one... The Protagonist climbs the ladder to a door. He tries it it’s open. He turns to see the launch move off into the gathering dark. The Protagonist ENTERS the wind turbine.

In the bare space, the Protagonist finds a SPORTS BAG, a a pallet of WATER and PROTEIN BARS. He opens the sports b to find passports, cash, credit cards and a HI-VIZ VEST. Under the vest is a small black cylinder. He unscrews the to find three SILVER SUICIDE PILLS. The Protagonist shake his head as he tosses them back into the bag.

The Protagonist EATS, DRINKS and EXERCISES by CLIMBING th endless interior ladder of the turbine. The stash of food water SHRINKS... The Protagonist does PULL-UPS at the very top of the ladd FEET DANGLING over the VERTIGINOUS DROP...
The Protagonist is woken by a repeated AIR HORN. He pulls himself off the cot, opens the door to find -  11.

A large CATAMARAN nosed up to the windmill, ladder in pla MAINTENANCE CREW in HI-VIZ VESTS moving on and off the turbine. Other boats service other turbines. The Protagon pulls on his VEST and CLIMBS down onto the catamaran.

The Protagonist disembarks with the rest of the wind-farm crew. As they file past a car the driver, also in hi-viz, steps out into line, leaving the door open, engine runnin The Protagonist gets in. The GPS is already set...
A bland suburban office park. The Protagonist gets out of car, wearing his hi-viz and carrying a clipboard. Heads inside, passing numerous STAFF coming out...
The Protagonist moves through the lobby unimpeded. Checki the tenant listings he sees - ‘WINDFARM TRANSITIONS - B-2
The Protagonist walks up to B-2.
With a hi-viz vest and a clipboard, you can get almost anywhere. Almost. The Protagonist turns to find a brusque young woman. This BARBARA. He joins his hands, interlacing the fingers...
A pretty obscure tenet. Using a key card, she ushers him through a door into -
Barbara hands the Protagonist a cup of tea.
No small talk, nothing that might reveal who we are, or what we do.
I thought I was here to find out what we do.  12.
You’re not here for ‘what’, you’re here for ‘how’. ‘What’ is your department. And not my business.
Well, to do what I do, I need some idea of the threat we face. Barbara considers the Protagonist. Sips her tea.
As I understand it, we’re trying to prevent World War Three.
Nuclear holocaust?
No. Something worse.
Barbara hands the Protagonist a semi-automatic. He reflexively checks the chamber and magazine - EMPTY.
Aim it and pull the trigger. The Protagonist SHRUGS, lifts the empty pistol, sights a target 25m away with several holes in it... He squeezes the trigger - BAM! - a shot. He is CONFUSED..
Check the magazine. The Protagonist checks the clip - THERE IS A ROUND IN IT.
How? Barbara pulls on PROTECTIVE GLOVES and removes the round the clip, placing it next to an identical one on a table.
One of these bullets is, like us, travelling forwards through time. The other one’s going backwards. Can you tell which is which? The Protagonist shakes his head. Barbara reaches forward
How about now? -  13. One of the rounds FLIES UP INTO HER HAND, FALLING IN REVE The Protagonist is taken aback. Barbara holds the round towards him so he can inspect it -
It's inverted - its entropy runs backwards. So, to our eyes, its movement is reversed. We think it’s a type of inverse radiation, triggered by nuclear fission.
You didn’t make it?
We don’t know how. Yet.
So where’d it come from?
Someone’s manufacturing them in the future. They’re streaming back at us. Barbara places the round on the table, in front of a CAME
Try it. He puts on a glove - moves his hand over it, nothing.
You have to have dropped it. The Protagonist reaches out again - it LEAPS UP INTO HIS HAND.
How can it move before I touch it? She cues up the recording of what he just did -
From your point of view you caught it, but from the bullet’s point of view... She plays it BACKWARDS -—
..-you dropped it. ON THE SCREEN: the round FALLS from his hand.
But cause has to come before effect.  14.
No. That’s just how we see time. She PULLS the round towards herself using one finger - th round follows her finger as if MAGNETIZED...
What about free will?
That bullet wouldn't have moved if you hadn’t put your hand there. Either way we run the tape, you made it happen. She LAUNCHES it up into her other hand -
Don’t try to understand it. Feel it. Barbara PLAYS with the round in increasingly IMPROBABLE, BEAUTIFUL MOVEMENTS... The round SHOOTS AWAY FROM HER - t Protagonist CATCHES IT...

Instinct. Got it. Barbara smiles, swaps him the round for the pistol. She t places a TRAY COVERED IN SHELL CASINGS beside him. The Protagonist aims at the target - a shell casing LEAPS into the gun - he FIRES, and a bullet hole near the bulls VANISHES —-
Why does it feel so strange?
You’re not shooting the bullet, you’re catching it.
Whoa. The Protagonist examines the target - no bullet holes.
I’ve seen this type of ammunition before.
In the field?
I was almost hit.  15.
Then you are exceedingly lucky... The Protagonist turns to her...
An inverted bullet passing through your body would be devastating. The inverse radiation would spread through your body. Like polonium poisoning. Not pretty. The Protagonist examines the rounds...
These look like today’s.
They may have been made today, then inverted years from now.
Where did you get them?
They came with the wall. I was assigned it, like all the material I’m studying here.
Do you have an analysis of the metals?
Sure. Why?
The mixture of alloys can tell me where they might have been made. Look, I know you said that ‘what’ is my business -
Let’s not go off-topic.
I’m not seeing Armageddon here. Barbara takes the round from him, and beckons him to foll
Between tall sets of DRAWERS...  16.

A bullet may not seem like much, but it’s a simple machine - lead bullet, brass casing, gunpowder. If they can invert this - I see no reason they couldn’t invert pretty much anything. Even a nuclear weapon can only affect our future. An inverted weapon might be able to affect our past as well. Barbara stops at a drawer. Gestures around herself -
Now that we know what to look for, we're finding more and more inverted material... She opens a drawer, revealing a VARIETY OF RUSTED BITS AN PIECES - SCREWS, CRACKED LENSES, METAL RODS, BUTTONS...
...remnants of complex objects. The Protagonist reaches out and lets a RUSTED BUCKLE leap into his hand.
So what do you think we’re seeing?
The detritus of a coming war. The Protagonist looks around at the MULTITUDE of DRAWERS.
The Protagonist walks out of an electronics store, openin new phone, and slips into the throng. He dials -
(over phone) Yup?
We live in a twilight world.
(over phone) No friends at dusk. I was told you'd left the building.
Even the dead need allies.  17.
(over phone) Specifically?
An assist in Mumbai. To get to Sanjay Singh.
(over phone) Singh? He never leaves his house, and his house... well, it’s -
Yes, it is - I’m looking right at it. Above the bustling street, a HIGH-RISE HOUSE, at least tw storeys tall, with two large balconies, towers over...
(over phone) I’1l see who’s on deck. Bombay Yacht Club, two hours. As the Protagonist hangs up, he spots a figure, on the to balcony. A WOMAN IN A SARI, standing high above the city.
The Protagonist enters the quiet ex-colonial establishmen Takes a seat. A BUSINESSMAN sits down next to him.
It seems you need an introduction to a prominent Mumbai local on short notice. I’m Neil. Neil offers his hand. The Protagonist takes it -
I need an audience with Sanjay Singh.
Not possible.
Ten minutes, tops.
Time isn’t the problem. Getting out alive’s the problem. (thinks) Would you take a child hostage? The Protagonist shakes his head.  18.
A woman?
If I had to. I’m not looking to make much noise here. Neil keeps thinking. Signals a waiter -
Vodka tonic. (gestures at the Protagonist) Diet Coke. The Protagonist stares at Neil. Neil looks up, confused.
What? You never drink on the job.
You're well informed.
It pays to be in our profession.
Well, I prefer club soda.
(grins) No, you don’t. Neil raps his knuckles on the table, thinking.
How’s your parachuting?
Broke an ankle in basic training. Singh’s house isn’t tall enough to parachute off of.
(thinks ) But it’s bungee-jumpable.
I don’t think ‘bungee-jumpable’ is a word.
It may not be a word, but it may be your only way out of that place. (a thought occurs) Or into it, for that matter.  19.
ARMED GUARDS patrol the balconies.
Inside one of the magnificent rooms, a middle-aged Indian mixes drinks. This is SANJAY SINGH.

location: LOW ROOFTOP NEXT DOOR TO HIGH-RISE HOUSE

text: Neil and the Protagonist race across the roof carrying a sports bag. Neil pulls out a WINCH, the Protagonist pulls a large CATAPULT, loops it around two pipes, glancing dow into the WALLED YARD at the foot of the high-rise house. Neil BOLTS the winch to the roof, the Protagonist sights upper balcony of the high-rise house, FIRES a ball with a line up and over the balcony railing...

The Protagonist and Neil lie next to each other as the WI RUNS, TENSIONING THEIR ELASTIC LINES... they LAUNCH themselves, FLYING UP to land against the side of the building - They RUN SILENTLY UP THE BUILDING, onto the UPPER TERRACE SHOOTING TWO GUARDS with silenced pistols...
Sanjay Singh hands a drink to the Woman in the sari. They move out onto the balcony -
The Protagonist surprises Sanjay, holds him at gunpoint -
(to the Woman) Stay back. (to Sanjay) I was almost taken out by a very unusual type of ammunition in Ukraine. I want to know who supplied it.
My name’s Sanjay. And you are? (silence) No chit-chat?  20. The Woman pushes a RED BUTTON on the wall -
There’s no one at the other end. No one who’s going to help you, anyway.
An alarm buzzes, the Security Guards are frozen, Neil has gun on them, a finger to his lips...
Sanjay tries to turn to see the Protagonist -
Why would I know who supplied it? The Protagonist pushes his head back around with the gun
The combination of metals is unique to India. If it’s from India, it’s from you.
A fair assumption -
Deduction.
Deduction, then. Look, my friend, guns are never conducive to a productive negotiation.
I’m not the man they send to negotiate... He COCKS his weapon - puts the gun to Sanjay’s head -
But I am the man people talk to.
(charm curdles) I can’t. I can’t tell you.
You're an arms dealer, friend - this may be the easiest trigger I’ve ever had to pull.

To say anything about a client would violate the tenets he lives by... 21. The Protagonist GLANCES at the Woman... whose fingers are casually INTERTWINED. The Protagonist brings his free han to hold the gun in both hands, fingers INTERLACED...
If tenets are important to you, then you can tell me. Everything.
Not while you have a gun to my husband's head. The Protagonist releases him.
Sanjay, make us a drink. INT. TERRACE OVERLOOKING MUMBAI, SANJAY’S HOUSE - LATER Overlooking the extraordinary bustle of the city. Sanjay left. His wife hands the Protagonist his drink -
I’m Priya Singh.
This is your operation?
A masculine front in a man’s world has its uses. The dealer you're looking for is Andrei Sator.
The Russian oligarch?
You know him?
Not personally. Made his billions in gas, moved to London and married an English girl. Said to be on the outs with Moscow.

Very good. Except the ‘gas’ he made his billions from was actually plutonium, and he’s said to be on the outs so he can feed British Intelligence whatever the Russians want them to think they know.  22.
None of which explains how or why you sold him inverted munitions.
When I sold him the rounds, they were perfectly ordinary.
So how did he get them inverted?
We believe he’s functioning as some kind of broker between our time and the future.
He can communicate with the future?
We all do. Credit cards, email, text - anything that goes into the record speaks directly to the future. The question is - can the future speak back? And, if so, what are they saying?
And I’m supposed to find out?
To get anywhere near Sator would take a fresh-faced protagonist... She reaches up to touch his cheek.
Fresh as a daisy. Get close, find out what he’s receiving and how.
Is it safe to involve British Intelligence?
I have a contact who’s out of Sator’s reach.
One of us?
No, he thinks we’re chasing plutonium. SIRENS. BANGS! Priya looks over to see POLICE CARS arrivi far below, in the WALLED YARD at the foot of her house...  23.
You'd better get out of here.
Can’t you explain things?

You have to start looking at the world in a new way - this conflict runs backwards and forwards simultaneously. Your name on a police report reveals your identity to the future - they pass it back to Sator -—
My cover’s blown before I get near him.
You got in - you must've had a plan for getting out. The Protagonist pulls a CLIP and cord from his harness -

Not one I loved. Priya watches him clip onto the balcony rail. Neil FLIES PAST, dropping from the balcony above. The Protagonist JUMPS, SLOWING as he DROPS BEHIND THE WAL OUT OF REACH OF THE POLICE, into a MARKET STREET and RELE his harness - disappearing into the crowd...
The Protagonist walks down the busy Mall, and up the step
The Protagonist enters, is approached by a STEWARD.
Can I help you, sir?
I’m Mr Crosby’s lunch.
I presume you mean Sir Michael Crosby’s lunch?
Presume away.  24.
If you'll follow me.
The Protagonist is shown to a table where a distinguished middle-aged man is already eating. CROSBY.
Started without you, hope you don’t mind.
I’1l catch up. (to the Steward) Same for me.
I‘'ll send the waiter.
No, just pass on the order. Crosby smiles at the Protagonist’s handling of the Stewar
I gather you’ve an interest ina certain Russian national.
Anglo-Russian. So I’1ll have to watch my step.
Indeed. He’s tapped into the intelligence services - I’ve warned them he’s feeding them rubbish, but they don’t seem to care.
Tell me about him.
I assume you’re familiar with the Soviet-era secret cities?
Closed cities, not shown on maps, built up around sensitive industries. Most of them have been opened up and renamed as regular towns.
Not the one Sator grew up in. Stalsk-12. (MORE)
In the seventies our people estimated its population at almost 200,000. Unacknowledged to this day. Thought to be abandoned.
Abandoned?

Some kind of accident. After which we think it became a site for underground tests. Just two weeks ago, same day as the Kiev Opera siege, our satellites detected a detonation in north-west Siberia, about where we think Stalsk-12 was.
Nuclear?
Big enough to be noticed. Sator emerged from this blank spot on the map with an ambition that eventually led him here, to buy his way into the British establishment.
Through his wife?
Katherine Barton, eldest niece of Sir Frederick Barton. She works at Shipley’s, met Sator at an auction.
He’s into art?

Like a lot of wealthy criminals, he thinks if he covers his walls with tasteful, expensive things it’ll distract from the bloodshed. Judging by the lovely girl he married, there might be something in it.
Happy marriage?
No. Practically estranged.
How do I get to Sator?
Through her, of course.  26.
You may have an inflated idea of my powers of seduction.
Hardly. We have an ace in the hole... Crosby slides a SHOPPING BAG over to the Protagonist’s fe The Protagonist looks inside: a small FRAMED DRAWING.
You’re carrying a Goya in a Harrods bag?
It's a fake, by a Spaniard named Arepo. One of two we confiscated from an embezzler in Bern. We hung on to this one for a rainy day - I felt the first drops when India called.
What happened to the other one?
A Rubens. It turned up at Shipley’s, where it was authenticated by Katherine Barton before going under the hammer. And who do you suppose bought it?
Her husband? Does she know it’s a forgery?
Hard to say. Rumour had it that she and Arepo were close. Crosby looks the Protagonist over -
Look, no offence, but this is a world where someone claiming to be a billionaire gets asked if they’re just a dollar billionaire.
And?
Brooks Brothers won’t cut it.
I’m assuming I have a budget.  27.
(tosses him a credit card) Save the world, then we’ll balance the books. Can I recommend a tailor?
I‘1l manage. You British don’t have a monopoly on snobbery, you know.
Not a monopoly. More of a controlling interest. The Protagonist rises, taking the credit card and the bag
Thanks for this. By the way, is she a Kate or a Kathy?
A Kat, I believe. The waiter arrives, bearing food, supervised by the Stewa
Could you box that for me?
Certainly not. The Protagonist smiles at Crosby, who nods goodbye.
Goodbye, Sir Michael.
Mothers stand at the railings waiting for their kids. One them, a smart YOUNG WOMAN, stands a little apart from the group. SCHOOLKIDS pile out of the school...

The Protagonist watches from across the road as the Young Woman SPOTS her son. She offers him her hand, but he reac up to take his NANNY’S. She moves her hand to pick someth off his jumper before he is put into the back of a BLACK RANGE ROVER with tinted windows. The Protagonist watches the Young Woman wave at the depar car carrying her child. Utterly alone.  28. EXT. Or someone who has something worth delaying your gratification for... Sator signals Volkov - Kat glances over as Volkov RISES -
We're finished.
Do you like opera? At this, Sator pauses. Waves off Volkov.
Not here. You sail?
I’ve messed around on boats.

Be on the dock at eight. Ready to do more than mess around. Kat, relieved, watches the Protagonist leave. EXT. DINING ROOM, YACHT —- MORNING Kat enters, dressed in sailing gear. Sator is already sea similarly dressed, reading his phone, with a cup of coffe
Max has missed too much school this year. I’m taking him back to England.
No, you’re not. He has a tutor here.
The school won't be okay with -
Yes, they will.
Can I finish?!  59.
Look around you - he has everything he needs here. A SERVANT places a plate with a silver cover in front of then pours her coffee.
You don’t care what he needs. You bought the trappings of a king, but we both know you’re a grubby little man playing power games with a wife who doesn’t love him any more. Sator looks at her.
You seem spirited today.
(defiant) Do I? Sator barely nods at the servant, who pulls off the lid..
Yes. You do. On the plate, instead of breakfast, is a small drawing. A ‘Rubens’. Kat freezes.

Were you worried it had been destroyed? Rest assured, instinct told me to remove it from the vault. I’ve always had instincts about the future. That’s how I built this life you no longer value. Kat looks up at him, not knowing what to say or do.
The Protagonist stands on the dock, dressed for sailing, watching the launch approach...
Morning. As he gets on, Kat ignores him. Sator enjoys this.

The Protagonist tries to catch Kat’s eye, but she will no look his way.  60. Sator hands the Protagonist a HARNESS and a HELMET... he looks at them, taken aback, then looks ahead - towards TW GRAPHITE DARK, HIGHEST TECH AMERICA’S CUP SAILING YACHTS, trimmed and ready.

(impressed) When you said sailing... EXT. SAILING YACHT DECK —- MOMENTS LATER Kat gets on, followed by Sator and the Protagonist. The rigging crew departs. Kat checks the sheets and winches. Sator indicates the harness.
You know how?
Aye, Captain. Sator gestures at Kat.
She's captain.
The boats FLY, SKIMMING THE WATER ON THEIR HYDROFOILS... Sator and the Protagonist are next to each other, standin one pontoon, LEANING OUT IN THEIR HARNESSES... Kat is at wheel, concentrating...
What do you know about opera?

In 2008 a remote Russian missile station was overwhelmed and held for a week. When the station was retaken, the plutonium 241 on one warhead was three quarters of a kilo lighter. The missing 241 surfaced at the opera-house siege in Kiev on the 14th.
You're well informed. But that doesn’t mean you have the plutonium.
I didn’t say I had it. I’m saying I know how to get it -  61.

Kat SWINGS the boat into the wind, SAIL FLAPPING FURIOUSL the wind catches it on the other side, and Sator and the Protagonist DUCK under the boom, RACING to the other side their harnesses SNAPPING TAUT as they lean out...
What do you propose?
Partnership.
I wouldn't partner with you. Kat works the wheel, tracking the other boat. Her look is of BOTTLED RAGE...
What’s wrong with me?
You know how to handle yourself, you have no record.
Someone in the arms trade with training who covers his tracks? Not that shocking.
For an intelligence agent. Sator holds the Protagonist’s gaze...
Secure your jib line. The Protagonist turns - Kat leans in to Sator -

Burn in hell, Andrei - - and YANKS HIS QUICK-RELEASE - he FLIES off the boat, SMASHING HEAD-FIRST into the waves - The Protagonist sees Sator FACE-DOWN, UNCONSCIOUS - he UNCLIPS, JUMPS to the wheel, SPINNING the boat OFF THE WI

head_text.subj: YOU CAN'T JIBE A BOAT LIKE THIS

text: The Protagonist STEERS the boat across the wind, SNAPPING BOOM ACROSS, ALMOST LOSING THE MAST —  62.
You can if you have to - He RELEASES THE SHEETS, SPILLING WIND, LOSING SPEED - as pass Sator he DIVES into the water - GRABS the oligarch - PULLS his face out of the water... Sator starts COUGHING.
The Protagonist dries himself - the door opens - Kat BURS in -
WHY DIDN’T YOU LET HIM DROWN?! She is on him, smashing her fists into his chest -
I need him.
To sell guns?!
I’m not who you think I am.
That, I know - he showed me the drawing.
I’m sorry.
Do you have any idea what you've done?
I had to get close to him. I don’t know what you think your husband is
We both know he’s an arms dealer.
He’s so much more.
What, then?
Andrei Sator holds all our lives in his hands. Not just yours. She looks bemused. A KNOCK at the door - she hides behind  63.
Mr Sator wants to see you. The Protagonist nods - pushes the door - Volkov stops it
Now.
He wants to see me without pants? Volkov lets the door shut. The Protagonist turns to Kat -
Trust me.
Save it. I’m not falling for it twice. The Protagonist looks at Kat. Sighs.
You have a better option? She looks into the Protagonist’s eyes. Assessing.
Whatever it takes to get what you want. Just like him. Not a second’s thought about me. My son. What do you think he’s going to do to me now? He pulls a gun from his bag. Offers it to her.
Try not to use this - She takes it - lets it point at him.
On anyone. INT. STUDY, SATOR’S YACHT - EVENING The Protagonist is shown in. Sator is sitting behind his desk. A DOCTOR is taking his blood pressure.
Enough - Sator RIPS the cuff off his arm, sending the doctor out - checks a fitness tracker on his wrist.  64.
See? Pulse of a man half my age. Drink with me. Sator pours them both tumblers of vodka.
It seems I now owe you my life.
It’s nothing. Sator fixes his black gaze on the Protagonist.
My life is not nothing. And I don’t like to be in debt.
Then pay me. No retribution against your wife. A dangerous beat. Then Sator GRINS -
You think she released my harness? (laughs ) It was my own mistake.
Then help me steal the 241. I need resources. It’s weapons-grade plutonium - that means special handling, containment facilities -
I know what it means. You lecture me about radiation. Andrei Sator, digging plutonium from the rubble of my city as a teenager?
Where?
Stalsk-12. My home. Sator sips his drink. Looks the Protagonist in the eye.
One pod of a warhead exploded at ground level, scattering the others. They needed people to find the plutonium...  65.

head_text.subj: MASSIVE MINING MACHINE, CARRYING A GIANT CROWBAR AND A GE

text: It became my first contract - nobody else even bid. They thought it was a death sentence.

head_text.subj: METAL CAPSULE. A FELLOW WORKER SEES THE SAME THING...

text: But one man’s probability of death is another man’s possibility for a life...

head_text.subj: PAPERS, WHICH HAVE HIS NAME ON THEM, REVEALING GOLD BARS
UNDERNEATH. THE FELLOW WORKER LEANS IN, STUDYING THE GOLD
THEY MAKE EYE CONTACT... SATOR STRIKES THE FELLOW WORKER

text: I staked my claim in the new Russia. Even now, my company is the only one to operate in the ruins.
The 241’s being transported through Northern Europe on its way to the long-term nuclear storage depot at Trieste. I’m told you have resources in Tallinn. Sator downs his vodka.

Stay with us tonight. I insist. INT. KAT’S STATEROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - NIGHT Kat slips the gun under her mattress, feels the lump - pu it out - moves to the desk, puts it in her jewellery case hearing a noise she jumps onto the bed, picks up a book. door opens. Sator. He locks the door.
What do you want, Andrei?
We're going to talk about today.
No, we’re not.  66. He removes a DIAMOND CUFFLINK...
No? Kat starts to get off the bed -
Don’t think for a minute you can treat me the way you treat your other women. Sator shifts to lean on the desk, cutting her off from th jewellery box. She sits back down. He removes his belt...
And how do you imagine I treat these other women? Sator slips the cufflink through a belt hole...
You think I force them into conversation? Sator tests the diamond studded belt against his palm.
You want to be quiet? Fine... He tosses her a pillow.
Bite down on that... Sator moves towards her - she looks at the jewellery box the desk - no way around him - Sator looks down at her. S looks up at his cold eyes...
Even a soul as blank and brittle as yours needs a response. Is fear and pain enough? Because that’s all I have to offer.
Then it’ll have to do.
Why didn’t you just throw me out?
If I can’t have you, no one can.
At what point do you give up and kill me?  67. Sator shrugs, wraps the belt a turn around his fist...
Turn over.
Touch me, I scream so loud he hears.
You think I'd let him interfere?
If he tried you’d have to kill him. End of deal. So leave me the fuck alone. A KNOCK at the door.

But he hears a RUMBLING... Sator, without a word, exits - EXT. SATOR’S YACHT, AMALFI COAST - NIGHT Sator GRABS binoculars from one of his men, peering out - A helicopter EMERGES from the darkness, THUNDERING IN... INT. GUEST STATEROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist listens to the incoming chopper - pulls o black Windbreaker - quietly opens his door... INT. PASSAGE, BELOW DECKS, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist makes his way, looking for an exit... EXT. SATOR’S YACHT, AMALFI COAST - CONTINUOUS The chopper descends to the landing pad - rotors turning Sator signals his men to head in... EXT. SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist is on a roof overlooking the helipad... He watches Sator’s men remove a LARGE, GRUBBY CAPSULE and take it below as the chopper LIFTS OFF...  68. INT. STORAGE AREA, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist makes his way through the storage area. Peering through a window, he sees - INT. ENGINE ROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Crew gathered around the capsule. Sator enters, wipes dir from the latches and opens it. Sator puts his hand over t open capsule, letting small, flat GOLD BARS leap from the capsule into his hand... he looks up, expectantly... The Crew SHOVES a CREW MEMBER forwards, onto his knees... eyes downcast, he reaches behind - pulls a gold bar from rear pocket. He offers it to Sator with TREMBLING hands. Sator takes it, eyes never leaving the Crew Member... who finally, tentatively looks up - BAM! Sator JABS him in the mouth with the gold bar, then SMASHES him over the head - INT. STORAGE AREA, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist is REPULSED by what he sees... INT. ENGINE ROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Sator steps back, breathless, from the Small Crew Member, lies motionless on the ground. As Sator raises his wrist to check his fitness tracker, B drips from the gold bar in his hand.

Ninety-eight. Not bad for such exertion. EXT. STORAGE AREA, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist SENSES, TURNS - CRACK! Volkov smashes his - KICKS him in the ribs - pistol-whips him... INT. ENGINE ROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - MOMENTS LATER The Protagonist, bleeding, is SHOVED into the room -—
He was at the window. Sator looks at the Protagonist, who nods at the capsule -  69.
I was curious.
My property shouldn’t concern you. Who are you? How do you come by your information about the opera?

Do I work for intelligence services? Several, just like you. You wouldn’t do business with someone who wasn’t savvy enough to be recruited. Hell, the CIA provides two-thirds of the market for fissile material.
They're usually buying, not selling. But we do live ina twilight world...
Is that Whitman? It’s pretty.
Next warning’s a bullet in your brain.
No balls in my throat?
There’1l be no time for such things in Tallinn. Sator gestures to his men - they lift the capsule. The Protagonist spots DRIED MUD from the latches on the table
Make your way there. I want Volkov on the team. The Protagonist struggles to his feet.
No. I spring the materials, you pay me off. Your wife does the exchange.
I never involve her in my business.
That’s why I trust her.  70.
(to Volkov) Put him ashore.
How do I contact you?
You don’t.
How do you advance me funds? Sator TOSSES the Protagonist the BLOODY GOLD BAR - the Protagonist FUMBLES it onto the table. Volkov SNEERS -
Handle the plutonium better than that. The Protagonist, looking Volkov in the eye, picks up the bar, scooping DRIED MUD into his hand, unseen.
The Protagonist walks the crowded streets with Neil.
What did you find on the gold?
Three hundred thousand at today’s price, no franks, mould marks. Nothing. Like it came from outer space.
Or the future.
How?
Dead drops. He buries his time capsule, transmits the location, then digs it up to collect whatever inverted material they’ve sent.
Instantaneous. Where’s he bury it?
Someplace that won’t be disturbed for centuries. What did the soil sample show?  71.
Northern Europe or Asia, radioactive. Dried blood was European.
Pretty broad.
This is the start of the run. The Protagonist looks back where they came. Then up ahead
When does the material arrive?
Thursday. When does Sator arrive?
I don’t know. But he’1l be here.
Cargo’s in a reinforced truck. Nuclear police front and back - SUVs with serious armour - you can’t break in through the windows.
And they can’t break out.
I don’t follow.
You will. So, light convoy through downtown, what’s the thinking?
A crowded, unpredictable traffic pattern makes planning an ambush almost impossible. The Protagonist looks around at the congestion.
They have a point. Is the convoy monitored from the air?
No, tracked by GPS - a wrong turn or an unscheduled stop, in comes the cavalry. Neil and the Protagonist hop a tram. The Protagonist stud the journey along the multi-lane road out of town.  72.
We need big guns, guns that make the point without being fired. We need a fast car that doesn’t look fast and four heavy vehicles, all different - bus, coach, eighteen- wheeler... Neil nods.
One of them has to be a fire truck. Neil looks up, interested.

Most of all, we need to set this up with nothing in the record - nothing electronic, nothing paper - I don’t want Sator ambushing us the second we spring the material. His ignorance is our only protection.
Kat sits beside Sator in the back, staring out the window
Everything salvaged from Oslo’s been shipped here.
Why am I here?
I don’t trust anyone else to assess the pieces.

location: FREEPORT, DOCKSIDE AREA, EDGE OF TALLINN

text: The MERCEDES pulls into the Tallinn Freeport. Several BODYGUARDS emerge, Sator heads inside. Kat follows, looki through a metal fence - an AUDI sits there, idling. Its driver is wearing an OXYGEN MASK...
Kat enters. Sator is at a table covered in WEAPONS.
See, Kat? Some of my favourites... He picks up a MACHINE GUN.  73.
Singed but salvageable, wouldn’t you say? She stares at the weaponry as if she’s never seen anythin like it before...
It’s not my area of expertise.
That’s right. You’d never have anything to do with such things. But this is where our worlds collide.
Andrei, what is this?
You know perfectly well what it is, Kat - the filthy business that put those clothes on your back and our boy in his school. That you thought you could negotiate your way around.
(in Russian, subtitled) The convoy’s due downtown in ten. Sator checks his watch. Nods at Volkov. Turns to Kat.
It’s time to go.
I’m not going anywhere with you. Sator SLAMS the machine gun back down on the table. Kat FLINCHES. Sator TURNS, enraged...
Look at me and understand - you don’t negotiate with a tiger - you admire a tiger, until it turns on you and you feel its TRUE. FUCKING.
Sator moves towards her - Kat pulls out a gun.
A LARGE UNMARKED TRUCK, with an ESCORT FRONT AND BACK, ma its stop and-start way through the downtown traffic.
The Protagonist and Neil watch the convoy cross an intersection, then pull forward, squeezing through traffi get ahead. Neil raises a walkie-talkie -
(into radio) Green? Two minutes. INT./EXT. GREEN TRUCK, TALLINN STREET -— CONTINUOUS The GREEN DRIVER nods at the GREEN CO-PILOT who holds the radio.
Check. He puts the radio down and pulls out a LARGE AUTOMATIC RI
The Protagonist checks his watch - Neil speaks into the r
Yellow? Sixty seconds.
(over radio) Sixty. Check.
Blue? Forty-five seconds.
(over radio) Forty-five. Check.
Red? On our way to you.
RED DRIVER and RED CO-PILOT are dressed as FIREFIGHTERS.  75.

The BMW pulls out, running behind the nuclear convoy. As convoy passes the cross street where the green truck, a FLATBED TRUCK, is sitting, it pulls out beside them, sett in to the right of the convoy.
Sator steps towards Kat -
Stay right there! She lifts the gun, intent -
You wouldn’t kill me.
I already tried.
You pushed me off a boat. You’re not going to shoot me in cold blood
My blood’s not cold, Andrei.
No, but you’re not angry enough. Sator edges towards Kat...
Because anger scars over into despair. I look in your eyes... He casually GESTURES at her -
I see despair. He SMACKS the gun out of her hands - PUNCHES her - she DR
Vengeful bitch. Living off me, pretending to be better... With a primal, animal viciousness, Sator SPITS at Kat.
Sator KICKS her once, in the side.  76.
You wanted to know when it’s better to kill you? You'll have your answer. He motions to Volkov, who, with a guard, lifts Kat and carries her towards the door. Sator puts an earpiece in h ear...
Tell me everything as it happens. Volkov nods, leaving - Sator walks through a large door.
Seal us this side! As the door shuts behind him, he walks towards a RED DOOR WITH A SMALL PORTHOLE, finding a spot in the shadows nearby...

The BMW watches the yellow truck, a BROADCAST TRUCK, whic pulls out just ahead of the nuclear convoy... the Protago looks back through the BMW’s side mirror, which is CRACKE The BMW sees the blue truck, a WRECKER, which pulls out o the larger street, just behind the convoy, which is now SURROUNDED ON THREE SIDES by the coloured trucks.
Volkov follows the convoy...
(into radio) Three trucks in place...
(over radio) Watch everything, give me all the details...

Sator sits in the shadows, listening intently... EXT. TALLINN STREETS -— CONTINUOUS The BMW ZIPS ahead, weaving through traffic, pulls alongs the fire truck.  77. The Protagonist, DRESSED AS A FIREFIGHTER, jumps out of t BMW and grabs onto the side of the fire truck, BANGING th side to signal the driver. The fire truck pulls out onto three-lane highway...

The fire truck pulls alongside the nuclear convoy, slotti in on the left, so that the convoy is now SURROUNDED... t Protagonist CLIMBS onto the roof beside the ladder, puts pair of heavy-duty gloves, pulls a diagonal backpack arou onto his front, checking his tools. Blue Co-pilot and Yellow Co-pilot COUNT DOWN in unison -

(over radio) Five, four, three, two, one, go... Blue truck, behind the convoy, GUNS THE ACCELERATOR, as yellow truck, in front of the convoy, SLAMS ON THE BRAKES The two SUVS are ACCORDIONED against the nuclear truck, t CARRIED FORWARD WITH THE NUCLEAR TRUCK as the coloured tr CLOSE FORMATION and PULL FORWARD, maintaining pace —
Go yellow! The YELLOW CO-PILOT in the broadcast truck sends out STAT
The SECURITY DRIVER is trying the radio - STATIC...
A POLICE OPERATOR is frowning, trying the radio. He calls his SUPERVISOR -
(in Estonian, subtitled) - Radio’s down. -
(in Estonian, subtitled) - Are they still moving? - The Police Operator checks his screen - NODS...  78.

TYRES HOWLING, the convoy GRINDS forward - Blue Co-pilot tosses a DYE PACK onto the windshield of the SUV - it BLA across the glass, obscuring the view - Yellow Co-pilot do the same in the front - the Guards are now BLIND, CANNOT

head_text.subj: THEIR DOORS OR SHOOT OUT THROUGH THE BULLET-PROOF VEHICLE

text: The Protagonist CLIMBS ONTO THE LADDER, lying on top... Inside, the Red Co-pilot operates the ladder controls... The ladder SWINGS OUT AT NINETY DEGREES, hanging the Protagonist DIRECTLY OVER THE NUCLEAR TRUCK... he PULLS a frame from his pack, unfolds it - fixes it to the roof. T ladder SWINGS him away - the frame EXPLODES - he SWINGS b through the smoke to find an OPENING and climbs into -
The Protagonist lands, gets his bearings, finds the SAFE. reaches into his pack...
An Estonian POLICE CAR pulls up behind the fire truck - t POLICEMEN spot SPARKS from the dragging bumper of the SUV the Policeman Passenger tries his radio... STATIC...
The Protagonist affixes a CHARGE to the safe - he runs a wire, pushing back into the farthest corner - BLASTS the Open -
Watching the Police through his mirror, Red Passenger rol down his window and props his ASSAULT RIFLE on the sill..
The Protagonist reaches into the safe... PULLS OUT an ORA PLASTIC CASE... reaches up to climb through the roof...

The Protagonist, orange case in hand, CLIMBS onto the lad - Red Passenger SWINGS his rear-opening door out and SHOO OUT the engine block of the police car which DROPS BACK a  79. The fire-truck ladder SWINGS the Protagonist back onto th fire truck - he climbs down onto the side - the BMW pulls alongside - he JUMPS into the car, which SPEEDS away...
Neil, driving, glances at the orange case -
We got it! The Protagonist opens the latches, flips open the lid... revealing the BLACK METAL SHAPE the size of a softball.
I’ve seen samples of encapsulation in every weapons class - this is not one of them. Neil looks back at the Protagonist. Serious.
It’s what he’s after. The Protagonist looks around at the surrounding traffic..
Check the radio chatter. Neil clicks on the radio - EMPHATIC GIBBERISH...
I can’t understand -
You said you spoke Estonian -
It’s not Estonian, it’s... backwards - Up ahead, an Audi is weaving through traffic, towards the BACKWARDS... Neil STARES...

The hell? The BACKWARDS-RUNNING AUDI flies at them, CLIPPING the wi mirror, ‘HEALING’ its crack. Behind them it SPINS AROUND, CHASE them, still running BACKWARDS... The BMW DODGES around traffic, trying to lose the backwar Audi, which pulls up to the back bumper - then ALONGSIDE the back is Sator, black eyes peering over a RESPIRATOR, gun to Kat’s head. She is BOUND and GAGGED, eyes TERRIFIE  80. Sator rolls the rear window down, holds up his hand, FING EXTENDED. He COCKS the gun at Kat’s head then starts COUN DOWN on his fingers... the Protagonist looks down at the BLACK METAL SHAPE in the case...
You can’t give it to him! The Protagonist LIFTS the closed case, LOWERS the window.
This isn’t plutonium. Sator is down to TWO FINGERS... Ahead of them in the road the Protagonist sees a CRASHED, SMOKING, UPSIDE-DOWN SAAB

It’s worse, goddammit! Both cars race towards the crashed Saab, which starts SHA as they approach - as they pass, THE CRASHED SAAB ROLLS VIOLENTLY OVER AND OVER between them until it is on its wheels, RACING BACKWARDS ahead of them, UNDAMAGED -— Neil regains his line, looks over at Sator who holds up h LAST FINGER... the Protagonist looks ahead to the Saab, STRUCK BY AN IDEA... the Protagonist looks at Sator - Then TOSSES the orange case at him - The Saab brakes, CUTTING BETWEEN THE TWO CARS... THE ORANGE CASE GLANCES OFF ITS WINDSHIELD, INTO SATOR’S HANDS... A forwards-driving Mercedes pulls up alongside the backwa driving Audi. Sator opens the rear door - he and the Audi driver climb BACKWARDS into the Mercedes - LEAVING KAT IN ACCELERATING BACKWARDS AUDI - the Mercedes DROPS FAR BEHI the BMW, Neil WATCHES -
He’s getting away!
He left her in the car! Neil looks forward to the backwards Audi, SPEEDING AWAY -
NO ONE IS AT THE WHEEL as the car continues to accelerate Kat lies in the back, breathing, groaning, but unconsciou  81.
The Protagonist stares ahead at the backwards Audi -

Pull up alongside... Neil looks back at the receding Mercedes, followed by the BACKWARDS SAAB... he turns - RACING to pull alongside the runaway backwards Audi, the Protagonist OPENS his door... - Ahead, a LOGJAM of traffic... The Protagonist FUMBLES to open the Audi door.

Kat! Kat! In the back, Kat swings her bound legs around - - The LOGJAM of cars and buses LOOMS CLOSER... The Protagonist OPENS the Audi door, but his own door hits it SLAMS IT CLOSED AGAIN... - The LOGJAM is DANGEROUSLY CLOSE... The Protagonist OPENS it again, Kat JAMS it open with her feet - the Protagonist CLIMBS ACROSS and PUSHES THE BRAKE WITH HIS HAND... The Audi SKIDS to a halt, the BMW ZOOMING PAST... The Protagonist starts to untie Kat, fumbling with his ra The BMW SKIDS to a halt, Neil JUMPS OUT - a CAR SKIDS to halt between the BMW and the Audi - BLAM, BLAM! Neil DUCK avoiding GUNFIRE -
(over radio) Sit tight - I’m calling in the cavalry.

What cavalry?! SMASH!!! The Protagonist and Kat are THROWN LIKE RAG DOLL across the car - the Mercedes has SWIPED the nose of the Volkov lays down COVER FIRE, pinning Neil as Sator’s men descend on the CRASHED Audi and pull the PROTAGONIST out the car - shoving him around the back of the Mercedes. Ka pulled from the wreck and put into the Mercedes - As they put the Protagonist INTO THE TRUNK, he sees Sator MOVING BACKWARDS behind the line of cars, from the BMW...  82.

The TRUNK OPENS - the Protagonist is PULLED OUT. Marched towards an entrance, he sees, through a steel fence divid the yard in two, SATOR, IN RESPIRATOR, WALKING BACKWARDS, PULLING KAT, FORWARDS, TOWARDS A DIFFERENT ENTRANCE... The Protagonist passes a stack of SHIPPING CONTAINERS, several of which are marked OSLO FREEPORT...
The Protagonist is taken past the table of weapons, throu large door, and through RED DOORS with a PORTHOLE...

Into A LONG CHAMBER DIVIDED IN TWO BY A GLASS WINDOW - A BIGGER VERSION OF THE ROTAS VAULT. The Russians push the Protagonist into a chair. This side is lit by RED LIGHT. On the other side of the glass, lit by BLUE LIGHT, Sator ‘ENTERS’ BACKWARDS, ‘PULLING’ Kat, who is now in a respirator. Sator ‘SHOVES’ her hard into a chair, removes own respirator, ‘FLIPPING’ it up onto a hook on the wall. The Protagonist looks into Kat’s frightened eyes... betwe them, embedded in a whirl of cracked glass, is a BULLET.. Sator TURNS to meet the Protagonist’s gaze - his movement have the surreal edge of backwards motion as he places hi GUN AGAINST KAT’S HEAD and pulls out his phone... He holds his PHONE up and plays a recording IN REVERSE -—
(via recording) If you’re not telling the truth, she dies. Sator moves the phone to his lips, SPEAKING IN REVERSE... Protagonist stares at him, bemused.
I don’t know what you’re talking about. Sator listens to this played backwards...
(via recording) You left it in the car not the fire truck, right?
Who told you that?  83.
(via recording) Tell me, now! Is it really in the
I don’t know!
(via recording) Tell me or I’1l shoot her again! The Protagonist looks at Kat, who is TERRIFIED -
(pleading) Tell him! - then at Sator -
Leave her alone!
(via recording) I don’t have time to negotiate. The Protagonist looks at the bullet hole in the glass - W OF SMOKE are gathering...
Listen to me! I can help you!
(via recording) Three...
Don’t!
Help me!
(via recording) Two...
A FAINT TRICKLE of glass dust rises to where the bullet i lodged in the window...
Wait!  84.
(via recording) One... Sator LIFTS Kat - PUSHES her up against the glass...
No! The SMOKE COALESCES as BANG! The bullet RIPS THROUGH KAT’ SIDE on its inevitable journey to Sator’s gun. Kat SCREAM
(via recording) Next one’s a bullet to the head... He holds up a finger - Kat is SCREAMING -
(via recording) One...
Please!
(via recording) Two...
No!
(via recording) Three...
Okay! Okay! The car! The BMW! I left it in the BMW! Kat’s screams subside to moans as she PASSES OUT...
(via recording) We’re going to check this is real.
It’s in the glove box! The door OPENS behind the Protagonist -—
Where did you leave it?  85. The Protagonist spins around - Sator, BEHIND HIM, SMASHES gun into the Protagonist’s cheek - THIS SATOR IS FORWARDS
Car or truck - which one?! Sator HITS him again - the Protagonist falls near the gla looks up through the glass to see ‘backwards’ Sator, on t blue side, staring at him dispassionately...
Which vehicle did you leave it in?! I need to know before I go out there!
I already told you! Forwards Sator looks through the window at his inverse se then turns back to the Protagonist -
I believe you... Sator puts his GUN to the Protagonist’s forehead -

(indicates Kat) You wanted her here. I hope you’1ll be happy together - Sator COCKS his weapon - BLAMBLAMBLAM! - the double doors behind the Protagonist SMASH open - PARAMILITARIES BURST GUNS BLAZING - the two guards are SHOT - Sator JUMPS FOR
On the other side of the glass, INVERTED SATOR runs backw towards the other vault door - BOTH SATORS JUMP INSIDE AND ARE GONE -— A Paramilitary SERGEANT enters, gun drawn -
Clear! The Protagonist looks at the empty vault -
Where'd he go?
The past.  86.

Sator runs out of the turnstile - into the blue side of t room - on the other side he sees the paramilitary AMBUSH REVERSE... for a few seconds he watches his older self interrogate the Protagonist, then fires up his phone, ste up to the glass - the Protagonist SHOUTS PASSIONATELY -
(via recording) It’s in the glove box!
We’re going to check this is real.
(via recording) Okay! Okay! The car! The BMW! I left it in the BMW! The sound of Kat’s MOANING is BUILDING and BUILDING. Sato holds up one finger -
Three...
(via recording) No! Adds a second finger - Kat is SCREAMING now -
Two...
(via recording) Please! And a third -
One. Next one’s a bullet to the head. Kat’s SCREAM CRESCENDOS as Sator GRABS her and pushes her against the glass, PULLS HIS TRIGGER, ‘HEALING’ her wound
One...
(via recording) Wait! Holds up two fingers -  87.
Two...
(via recording) Don’t! Sator holds up three fingers -
Three -
(via recording) Listen to me! I can help you!
I don’t have time to negotiate. The Protagonist looks confused -
(via recording) Leave her alone!
Tell me or I’11 shoot her again!
(via recording) I don’t know!
Tell me now! Is it really in the
(via recording) Who told you that?
You left it in the car not the fire truck, right?
(via recording) I don’t know what you’re talking about.

If you’re not telling the truth, she dies. Sator GRABS his respirator from the hook, PULLS Kat to he feet - DRAGS her backwards through the door, down a corri into an AIRLOCK, pulls off her respirator, puts his on...  88.
The Protagonist looks through the glass at Kat -
She’s been shot!
Get her this side! Respirator-clad Paramilitaries pull Kat out of the room. Paramilitary Sergeant turns to the Protagonist.
Was she shot with an inverted round? The Protagonist NODS. Neil enters - gestures to the Serge
This is Ives. He’s one of us - The Protagonist GRABS Neil, THROWS him up against the wal
Us?! Who are these guys?
Priya’s. Ours. The Paramilitaries bring Kat into the room - the MEDIC, moving SWIFTLY, examines Kat’s wound. The Protagonist puts his arm AGAINST NEIL’S THROAT —
How did Sator know about the ambush?
Posterity. An ambush on the streets can’t stay out of the record -
Bullshit - he knew every move we made! Somebody talked - was it you?!
No.
At every stage, you’ve known more than you should. I’m asking you one more time. Did you talk?  89.
Nobody talked. They’re running a temporal pincer movement. Ives is next to the Protagonist, ready to help Neil...
A what?
A pincer movement. But not in space - in time. Half his team moves forwards through the event - he monitors them, then attacks from the end, moving backwards. Knowing everything.
Except where I stashed the plutonium. The Protagonist lets Neil go...
Which is not plutonium, is it?
I told you - it’s what he’s after. And you just told him where it is.
I lied. Neil looks at Kat, bleeding out on the gurney.
Jesus.
He couldn't verify from inside the room, he’d have shot her anyway. Lying is standard operating procedure. The Medic steps away from Kat, shakes his head.
It’s spread too far.
Meaning what?
She’s going to die.
(to Protagonist) Standard operating procedure? (MORE )
(to Ives) Can’t you stabilize inverse radiation by inverting the patient?
That takes days - The Protagonist points at the turnstile -
Let's go.
We took control of this machine minutes ago - before that it’s Sator’s.
How long will she live on this side?
Three hours, tops. The Protagonist thinks. He looks at Kat, who is dying.
I’m taking her through. I’m not going to let her die, I’1l take my chances out there.
Chances of what? We’ve got no way to bring you back.
We find another machine.
A week ago? Where? The Protagonist looks at Neil - they have the same idea -
Oslo.
That facility’s impregnable. It’s inside an airport security perimeter.
Not last week, it wasn’t. We’re going in. You might as well help. Ives, shaking his head, joins in. As they carry Kat towar the vault door, Ives points at the glass partition -  91.
This is the proving window... as you approach the turnstile if you don’t see yourself through the proving window, do not enter the machine.
Why not?
If you haven’t seen yourself reverse-exit the machine, you won't be getting out. Okay, first in, last out. Get into the turnstile, pass through - I’1l already be there with her.
Is that gonna work? Ives pauses, watching activity on the other side of the window -
(points) Yeah... The Protagonist turns to see HIMSELF on the other side of glass, MOVING IN REVERSE, wheeling KAT ‘TOWARDS’ THE VAUL

Let's go! Ives OPENS the door - the Protagonist takes one last look his backwards self ‘entering’ the machine, then STEPS INS We follow him in as the door SHUTS behind him - he puts h back to the wall - the machine starts CLANKING like an MR the door opens on the other side - he STEPS OUT... To see Ives struggling with Kat - he moves to help - Neil already there (first in, last out). The Protagonist looks through the glass to where he and I now appear to be moving backwards... The Medic tends to Kat.
She’s stabilizing slowly. I'll clean and close, the rest is time.
How long does she need?  92.
4 or 5 days. A week to be sure.
(to Neil) Figure out how to get us to Oslo - I’ve got to get back out there -
To do what?
To stop Sator getting away with the whatever it is I just gave him.
You didn’t - you lied about where it was. Wait, you’re going out there for her.
He threatened to kill her in the past... if he does, what happens to her here?
It’s unknowable. If you’re there to make a change, you’re not here to observe its effect.
What do you believe?
What’s happened’s happened. We have to save her here and now. And if you go back out there you might hand him exactly what he’s after.
Don’t let them take her back through -
I won't.
You can’t stay here.
And we don’t have much time - so find us a nice cosy shipping container that just came off a ship from Oslo... The Protagonist moves towards the door. Ives steps up -  93.
This is cowboy shit. You have no idea what you’re getting into if you go through that door.
Well, I’m going, so any tips would be welcome. Ives sees determination. Shakes his head.
Wheeler, brief him. The female Paramilitary, WHEELER, hands the Protagonist a respirator -—

You need your own air - regular air won’t pass through the membranes of inverted lungs. The number-one rule - don’t come into contact with your forwards self - that’s the whole point of these barriers - Wheeler BANGS on the proving window -
And protective suits - if any of your particles came into contact - The Protagonist is putting on the respirator -
What?
Annihilation.
That’s bad, right? The Protagonist follows Wheeler into a corridor lined wit RESPIRATORS and HAZARD SUITS... at the end is an AIRLOCK.

When you exit the airlock, take a moment to orient yourself - things will feel strange. When you run, the wind will be at your back. If you encounter fire, ice will form on your suit, as the transfer of heat is reversed. Gravity will feel normal, but appear reversed for the world around you. Don’t worry about things falling, so much as rising. (MORE )

If you see an object demonstrating unprompted instability, stay clear, it may be about to leap into the air. You may experience distortions to your vision and hearing - this is normal - light waves and sound waves are propagating away from you. This should clear as your brain adjusts.
Can I drive a car?
Cowboy shit. Ives and Neil are grabbing respirators...

I can’t vouch for the handling, friction and wind resistance are reversed. You’re inverted, the world is not. You can’t fight the prevailing wind of entropy. Don’t try flying a plane - it’d fall out of the sky. Once again, you’re inverted, the world is not - and those forces will be pushing back on you continuously. The Protagonist turns to Neil -
Was there a transponder on the case?
He’ll have tossed the case -

I’m going backwards - that’s the ball I have to follow. Give me the reader. Neil hands him a phone. The Protagonist sticks a Bluetoot earpiece in his ear, passes into the airlock - Wheeler sh it behind him. Then opens the OUTER DOOR...

The Protagonist emerges into a strange world - the air fe different, the friction of his feet on the asphalt feels different. He looks up at birds flying backwards... at st contracting... at a pile of dust sucking itself bigger... In the yard he spots the SAAB... he runs over, finds the sitting on the front tyre -  95.

The Protagonist LOOKS in the glove box - NOTHING - LOOKS the wheel well - NOTHING - the back seat - NOTHING. He gi up - starts the engine... pulls out, gently, feeling out strange handling of the vehicle...

The Protagonist steers the car around BACKWARDS-MOVING TRAFFIC and BACKWARDS-WALKING PEDESTRIANS, MARVELLING... People STARE at the car as it approaches, as if they alre know a backwards-driven car is heading their way (which, course, they do). He checks the phone - a blinking dot half a mile away - h GUNS it, FISHTAILING unexpectedly...

We see the fire fight from before IN REVERSE - Neil layin down fire from between cars, Kat carried ‘back’ to the Audi... Behind Neil, Sator, MOVING FORWARDS, checks the glove compartment of the BMW... NOTHING. FUMING, he heads back the Mercedes, DUCKING behind cars, bullets FLYING...

The Protagonist pulls onto a busy highway where the cars FACING HIM, BUT MOVING IN HIS DIRECTION... The Saab races along, the only normal-looking car on a ro full of cars SPEEDING BACKWARDS... On the phone, the flashing dot is CLOSER... Slowing, the Protagonist spots the ORANGE CASE lying empt the side of the road. He PULLS OVER some distance away - JUMPS out of the car - pulls out his BLUETOOTH EARPIECE a WEDGES it between the foam padding and the orange plastic The Protagonist heads back to his car, checks the signal his phone... PEERS at the case... The case SHUDDERS TO LIFE - LEAPS INTO THE WINDOW OF A

The Protagonist PEELS OUT, DUST FLIES UP IN CLOUDS THAT D FULLY BLOSSOM as expected, but CONTRACT... The Protagonist STRUGGLES with the wheel, trying to keep car on the road with its unaccustomed handling...  96.
Christ! He can see the Mercedes up ahead, weaving through traffic

The Mercedes races back up the off-ramp - the Saab follow weaving through traffic which faces him, but travels backwards - As the Saab gets within a couple car lengths, his phone c in with audio from his Bluetooth bug in the Mercedes -
(over radio) - the material’s not in the case - Sound cuts in and out - FRAGMENTS of voices - he struggle keep pace with the Mercedes - he listens hard -
(over radio) -Get the other sections of the algorithm to the hypocentre- -He was lying- -it wasn’t in the BMW-
(over radio) So where is it?

The Protagonist finds a clear lane and guns the engine, tracking the Mercedes as it pulls alongside the Audi, rac ‘forwards’, and Sator, orange case in hand, climbs from t Mercedes into the Audi... The Audi pulls alongside the BMW - the Protagonist, sensi the moment, LOWERS HIS WINDOW... Sator lifts the orange c BUT HIS EYES ARE ELSEWHERE —- Inside the Saab, the Protagonist hears BANGING - the BLAC METAL SHAPE ‘unwedges’ from where it’s been stuck down th side of a seat - ‘BOUNCING’ around the interior - The Saab CUTS between the Audi and the BMW - The orange case FLIES OUT OF SATOR’S HANDS - BOUNCES OFF SAAB'S WINDSHIELD, ‘LANDING’ IN THE BMW -

head_text.subj: JUST AS THE BLACK METAL SHAPE JUMPS OUT OF THE SAAB AND I

text: THE (FORWARD) PROTAGONIST’S LOWER HAND...  97. Sator, SEEING THIS, YANKS the wheel - CLIPS the Saab - th Protagonist STRUGGLES for control - but the Saab SPINS AN ROLLS DOWN THE HIGHWAY, COMING TO REST ON ITS ROOF. The Protagonist, upside down in the car, regains consciousness... fuel leaks, pooling outside the window.. sees expensive shoes approach, then Sator’s face peering at him. In his hand is a LIGHTER.
I saw the hand-off. You made me shoot her for nothing. Sator tips his lighter to read his fitness tracker...
You did get my pulse above 130. No one’s done that before. Not even my wife. Backing away, Sator DROPS the lighter, the fuel EXPLODES,

head_text.subj: THE FLAMES CONTRACT, SPARING THE PROTAGONIST WHO LIES THE

text: The Protagonist comes to on a stretcher. Kat is ona stretcher next to him. Neil sits between them. The Protagonist looks at his hands, feels his face, confused.
The heat transfer was reversed - you may be the first case of hypothermia from a gasoline explosion in history.
At this point, nothing surprises. The Protagonist looks around the shipping container.
You left Ives and his team one hell of a clean-up.
We’re on our way back to Oslo?
In a Rotas shipping container.
He’s got the material, Neil. I handed it to him on a plate.  98.
I warned you -
‘What’s happened’s happened.’ I get it, now. But it’s tough to take things on trust from people speaking half-truths.
That’s not fair -
You were part of this before we met. Were you working for Priya?
No.
Who recruited you, Neil?

It can't possibly do you any good to know that right now. When this is over, if we’re still standing and you still care, you can hear my life story, okay? Kat GROANS, her eyes flicker open to see the Protagonist.
I’m sorry I involved you.
You need to tell me what’s going on.
Apparently, Neil here knows more about it than I do. (to Neil) Good luck, pal.
By telling Kat anything we’re compromising her in Priya’s eyes.
In Priya’s eyes she’s already compromised. And she has a right to know why she might die.
I’m going to die?  99.
Not if we have anything to say about it.
And we do.
Who are you?

Let me start with the simple stuff. Every law of physics operates the same forwards and backwards, except one. Entropy... The Protagonist moves to the back of the container, pulls his phone, checks Neil’s attention is on Kat...

(via recording) -bring- -final section- -directly to the hypocentre- -with the other parts- -the algorithm- The recording breaks up. The Protagonist puts the phone a FLEXES his elbow, feeling out some pain... He rolls up hi sleeve - there is a DARK PATCH of skin forming -
Are you injured?
What’s the ‘algorithm’, Neil?
The 241 is one section of it. One out of nine. It’s a formula rendered into physical form so it can’t be copied or communicated. A black box with one function.
Which is?
Inversion. But not objects or people. The world around us.
I don’t understand.
As they invert the entropy of more and more objects... Neil holds his hands, fingers spread, pointing at each ot  100.
The two directions of time are becoming more intertwined... He slowly brings his fingers together, into the ‘Tenet’ gesture -
But because the environment’s entropy flows in our direction... He pushes one hand back with the other - Neil nods,
...we dominate. They’re always swimming upstream. It’s what saved your life - the inverted explosion was pushing against the environment.
Pissing in the wind.
But the algorithm can change the direction of that wind. It can invert the entropy of the world.
And if that happens?
Oh, end of play.
‘End of play’? Can you be a little more precise?
Our present wiped out, our past obliterated. Everyone and everything who ever lived destroyed instantly. Precise enough?
Including my son. gravely. Kat winces, clearly in pain.
Let me sedate you - the more you sleep the faster you'll heal. Neil injects Kat in the arm. Her eyes close.  101.
Close on the hull, we see the water UNSPLASHING at the bo and SUCKING UNDERNEATH the stern as the ship steams majestically backwards through the cold North Sea...
BANGING wakes the Protagonist - Neil is at a peephole.
We're on a truck. Shouldn’t be too long now.
Neil is awake. He looks over at the Protagonist, who is examining a LESION on his right arm...
You in pain?
Must’ve got nicked in Tallinn. (rolls down sleeve) I’ve been thinking... we’re their ancestors. If they destroy us, won’t that destroy them?
Bringing us to the grandfather paradox.
The what?
The classic thought experiment - if you went back in time and killed your own grandfather, how could you have been born to commit the act?
What’s the answer?
There is no answer, it’s a paradox. But in the future, those in power clearly believe that you can kick Grandpa down the stairs, gouge his eyes and slit his throat without consequence.
Could they be right?  102.
It doesn’t matter. They believe it, so they’re willing to destroy us. Can I go back to sleep?
No. I thought of something else.
Great.
This reversing the flow of time... doesn’t us being here now mean it never happens? That we stop them?
Optimistically, I’d say that’s right.
Pessimistically?
In a parallel-worlds theory, we can’t know the relationship between consciousness and multiple realities. Does your head hurt yet?
Yes.
Try sleep.
A final THUD, then STILLNESS. The Protagonist moves to th peephole, unplugs it and peers out: The WRECKED PLANE, FLOODLIT, sitting outside the COLLAPSE WALL which has been sealed with STEEL FENCING.
Shit. They didn’t take us inside.
What do we do?
We use the breach. The chaos right after impact. Get ready. They both turn to look at the unconscious Kat.
Is she healed enough?  103.
I don’t know. I’ve never done this before.

The Protagonist is at the peephole - the ground is WET. C UP CREWS and INVESTIGATORS swarm backwards over the scene SIRENS start... Water FLOWS UP ONTO THE PLANE’S WINGS. FI CREWS ‘unpack’ their equipment around the wreck...
Fire crew’s there... The Protagonist WINCES as he pulls his arm into its sleev
We get Kat through the breach, I take care of Sator’s man and secure the vault. Then you bring her in.
How’s the arm?

Not good. The Protagonist spots a HOLE in the fabric of his black s - directly over the lesion on his arm.. Neil straps a respirator to the gurney - puts the mask ov Kat’s face, then puts another on himself. He gives Kat a sedative.

We move the second we hear the engines. Neil looks at Kat, unconscious on the gurney. He TIGHTENS straps - throws a reflective blanket over her... The SIRENS are DEAFENING - the Protagonist flexes his arm clearly in a lot of pain. Neil spots BLOOD dripping from Protagonist’s wrist -
You're bleeding. Let me take a look SUDDENLY THEY HEAR THE BUILDING WHINE OF JET ENGINES. The Protagonist YANKS up the handle, THROWS OPEN THE DOOR -  104.

Onto PANDEMONIUM - FIRE CREWS BATTLE the blaze, chunks of metal on the ground IGNITE, SHUDDER and LEAP ONTO THE AIRFRAME... STREAMS of water RISE up onto the plane - The Protagonist HURRIES BACKWARDS, PULLING THE GURNEY tow the plane, steering around debris that might suddenly - A SHEET OF FLAMING METAL SPINS off the ground, shearing i them, KNOCKING the GURNEY - they duck, HOLDING ON TO THE GURNEY, the metal FLIES into the air, SLAMS into its hole the side of the plane... the Protagonist spots a line und the fuselage, between flames, towards the breach...

Come on! Neil looks up as BLACK SMOKE GATHERS, FORMING A MASSIVE C OVER THE PLANE... a SHOCK WAVE starts to BUILD in the air around them - the Protagonist PULLS Kat and Neil under th fuselage as CURTAINS of FIRE start GATHERING around the wings, CENTRED on a HALF-DESTROYED JET ENGINE — They pass through the hole in the wall LICKED AT BY FLAME WHICH LEAVE FROST ON THEIR CLOTHES -— As they clear into the building, DEBRIS in front of them start SHAKING - they DUCK as the MASSIVE BUILD OF ENERGY CLIMAXES in a CACOPHONOUS REVERSE EXPLOSION as THE JET EN
The Protagonist draws his gun - turns to Neil -

I’m going in. Wait here. The Protagonist turns, rushing up onto the loading dock - The LOOSE JET ENGINE, under FULL THRUST, ATTACHED to the wing, SWINGS BACK AND FORTH, wreaking REVERSE HAVOC... The Protagonist pauses, LISTENING - he can hear BACKWARDS VOICES on the other side of a ROLLER DOOR - the loose jet engine TURNS, BLASTING AIR at the Protagonist with its INVERTED THRUST - the Protagonist is SMASHED through the bottom of the roller door -  105. INT. VAULT, FREEPORT —- CONTINUOUS

head_text.subj: INTO HIMSELF AND NEIL, DRESSED AS BUSINESSMEN AS IN THEIR

text: EARLIER VISIT TO THE ROTAS VAULT - the Protagonist (weari black clothes and gas mask) TACKLES the EARLIER PROTAGONI (wearing business suit), the Earlier Protagonist THROWS t Protagonist onto the ground, getting his gun - SHOUTING at him INCOMPREHENSIBLY - KICKING his INJURED AR AGAIN AND AGAIN - the Protagonist SCREAMS... The Earlier Protagonist puts his GUN TO THE PROTAGONIST’S HEAD... EAR NEIL GRABS HIS ARM, RESTRAINING him... The Protagonist and Earlier Protagonist STRUGGLE, ROLLING across the floor with the unique physics of forward actio merged with backwards action... They STRUGGLE through the BLUE DOOR of the Rotas vault. T Protagonist gets his gun - the Earlier Protagonist STABS in the arm with his lockpick - ‘HEALING’ his wound - ENERGIZING him - He FLIPS the Earlier Protagonist up against the glass, LI his gun - SHOOTS past the Earlier Protagonist’s head, put a BULLET HOLE through the glass - Glancing at the OPEN TURNSTILE DOOR, the Protagonist FIRE again, forcing the Earlier Protagonist TOWARDS the door.. looks through the proving window - no one there...

Come on, come on... The Protagonist FIRES AGAIN AND AGAIN, forcing the Earlie Protagonist closer and closer to the open turnstile... The Earlier Protagonist takes hold of the gun - the barre coming around onto the Protagonist who instinctively EJEC the magazine, REMOVES the SLIDE, tossing it aside, leavin the Earlier Protagonist with a useless STRIPPED AUTOMATIC Earlier Neil RACES backwards into the other half of the r - Through the bullet-riddled glass the Protagonist sees HIMSELF (GAS MASK, BLACK CLOTHES) RUN BACKWARDS into the The Protagonist LEAPS INTO THE TURNSTILE - we FOLLOW the Protagonist through the machine - BURSTING OUT on the oth side - straight into Earlier Neil, who now MOVES FORWARDS the Protagonist PUSHES past - As the confrontation on the other side of the glass plays again, FORWARDS... the Protagonist RACES for the RED DOOR Neil in PURSUIT -  106.

The Protagonist runs, pursued by Earlier Neil, skidding around the corners of the vault corridor - Earlier Neil gets a hand on the Protagonist’s GAS MASK an YANKS - it comes off in his hands... this time we see tha Neil is looking at the UNMASKED PROTAGONIST. Neil, surpri turns and BOLTS back the way he came - the Protagonist watches him go, then TURNS -
The Protagonist races down the angled corridor - The Protagonist SKIDS through the doorway leading out of corridor and into the SMOKE-FILLED cargo area where he left...
Neil races up to the Earlier Protagonist, grab his arm -
NO! Don’t kill him!

...-Neil (respirator on) guarding Kat, STRAPPED to the gu Behind them, the fire crew battle the blazing plane. Neil already looking up at the Protagonist who POINTS right - Protagonist DUCKS THROUGH the breach, into the chaos... N moves BACKWARDS towards the outside...

The Protagonist RUNS THROUGH THE SMOKE AND FLAME, DODGING DEBRIS FALLING FROM THE PLANE... heading towards the EMERGENCY SERVICES... The Protagonist CREEPS along the side of an AMBULANCE... AMBULANCE DRIVER spots him in the mirror - the Protagonis DARTS in, HITTING the driver in the face -

Neil (moving FORWARDS) ducks back behind the corner as Earlier Protagonist (business suit) and Earlier Neil (business suit) walk backwards away from the Rotas vault. Neil pushes Kat towards the broken roller door and pushes inside...  107.

The Protagonist SWERVES the ambulance, trying to get clos the breach - the Protagonist SPINS the ambulance around a close to the breach as possible. He JUMPS out - opens the back - PEERS into the smoke and water... waiting... Neil EMERGES, pushing the gurney with Kat on -
The Protagonist DRIVES, sirens blaring.
You knew it was me coming out of that vault. Why didn’t you say?
That’s a lot of explaining when someone’s about to put a bullet in their own brain.
But afterwards -
