With things the same, I knew you’d be okay. What’s happened happened. If I'd told you and you acted differently... who knows? The policy is to suppress.
Whose policy? Neil GRINS, offering his hand -
Ours, my friend. We’re the people saving the world from what might have been...
Neil and the Protagonist are in the back, checking on Kat whose eyes OPEN.
Kat?
I’m here. Neil checks the dressing on her wound -  108.
Be quite a scar, but you’re okay. We did it.
Did what? Andrei’s got the algorithm. You don’t know where he is - Neil looks at the Protagonist -
Or when.
Get Priya here to Oslo.
Why?
If I don’t do something now, in two days she’1ll tell me about the 241.
Nothing can change that.
We'll see. Just get her here.
The Protagonist makes his way through the crowd, followin elegantly dressed lady... Priya. He takes her by the arm, away from the crowd...
Hello, Priya.
What’s going on? Where’s Neil?
Nursing Katherine Barton. Who almost died because of you.
What did I do?
It’s what you’re going to do. In two days you’re going to have me dangle plutonium 241 in front of the world’s most dangerous arms dealer... I want to know why.  109.
You let him get hold of 241?
No. I let him get hold of the algorithm. Priya looks at the Protagonist, surprised he knows the te
Tell me about it, Priya.
It’s unique. The scientist who built it took her own life so she couldn't be forced to make another.
A scientist in the future?
Generations from now.
Why did she have to kill herself?
You're familiar with the Manhattan Project? As they approached the first atomic test, Oppenheimer became concerned the detonation might produce a chain reaction, engulfing the world.
They went ahead anyway, and got lucky.
Think of our scientist as her generation’s Oppenheimer - she devises a method for inverting the world, but becomes convinced that by destroying us, they destroy themselves.
The grandfather paradox.
Unlike Oppenheimer, she rebels, splitting the algorithm into nine sections and hiding them the best place she can think of...
The past. Here. Now.  110.
There are nine nuclear powers. Nine bombs. Nine sets of the most closely guarded materials in the history of the world. The best hiding places possible.
Nuclear containment facilities.
Sator’s lifelong mission, financed and guided by the future, has been to find and reassemble the algorithm.
Why did they choose him?
The necessary combination of greed and ambition. But mostly, he was in the right place at the right time.
The collapse of the Soviet Union.
The most insecure moment in the history of nuclear weapons.
And there he was. How many of the sections does he have?
After the 241? All nine.
Christ. And that’s why you’re going to do it differently this time.
To change things? So Katherine won’t get hurt?
So Sator won’t get the algorithm.
If that universe can exist, we don’t live in it.
Let’s try. You’re going to warn me.  111.
No. I’m not. Ignorance is our ammunition. If you’d known what the algorithm was, would you have let it fall into Sator’s hands?
You want him to get the last section?
It’s the only way he'll bring together the other eight.
I was supposed to steal it, then lose it?
(smiles) Mission accomplished.
You used me.
As you used Katherine. Standard operating procedure. You’ve done your part.
My part? I’m the protagonist of this operation -
You're a protagonist. (off look) What? You thought you were the only person capable of saving the world?
No. But I am. Because I haven’t told you where he’s assembling the algorithm, or when.
You’re about to.
No, I’m not. So deal us in.
Why would you involve her again?
She can get close to him.  112.
Does he still trust her?
He thinks she’s dead. But he used to.
You have started looking at the world in a new way.
And now it’s your turn. Assuming she makes it out alive, whether or not you feel she knows too much...
I can’t.
If you don’t have the authority, talk to whoever’s in charge of loose ends. I need your word that she and her son will be safe.
(frustrated) What good is someone’s word in our line of business? The Protagonist just looks at her. She NODS.
They'll be safe. There’s a rally point offshore at Trondheim. Get yourselves up there...

Chinooks cross BACKWARDS through WHITE TURBINES. Service boats pull people off ladders. A large ICEBREAKER sits ne EXT. ICEBREAKER, BARENTS SEA —- CONTINUOUS The Protagonist, IN RESPIRATOR, does PULL-UPS on deck, th movement ‘shaking’ snow back up onto the pipe...
Ives has a team ready to invert. CUT BACK TO THE PROTAGONIST IN OSLO -—  113.
You have a turnstile? The exact technology we’re trying to suppress?
The Protagonist watches a CHINOOK long-line a container..

Fighting fire with fire is a treacherous business, but there are people in the future who need us to continue the algorithm’s journey into the past. You see... Taking a look at the sea CHURNING BACKWARDS into the ster the inverted ship ‘progresses’, he heads below deck...

head_text.subj: CUT BACK TO PRIYA IN OSLO -

text: ...Tenet wasn’t founded in the past - it will be founded in the future.

Coming out of an AIRLOCK, he removes his respirator. Walk past Wheeler drilling TENET SOLDIERS - non-inverted soldi in respirators SPAR with inverted soldiers. Neil is among troops practising ‘LIFTING’ weapons from the floor.
The Protagonist enters. Kat sits at a window.
I can’t get over the birds... The Protagonist follows her look to a bird flying backwar
How are you feeling? She lifts her shirt to reveal a LARGE, JAGGED, ANGRY SCAR
Tell me you're going to kill him.
I can’t. Neil enters without interrupting. Kat rises. Steady.  114.
Why not? I think you’ve probably killed a lot of people -
Not with a dead man’s switch.
A what?
That fitness tracker he wears...
He’s obsessive about his health.
It’ll be linked to a switch. Probably a simple email burst, revealing the location of the dead drop, set to fire if his heart stops.
In effect, his death activates the algorithm. He dies, the world ends - no one dares kill him. Kat realizes...
No, you’ve missed the point. He’s intending to end his life.
Why?
He’s dying. Inoperable pancreatic cancer.
And he’s taking the world with him.
If he can’t have her, no one can.
What?
Something he said, once. He has a child, for God’s sake.
Kat, he gets to choose the time and place for the end of the world. What moment? What does he choose?  115.
You told me about a holiday, where you let him feel loved...
Viet Nam. On our yacht. His yacht.
You said he vanished - what day?
I went ashore with Max, he flew off. I don’t know what date it was...
The 14th. Ten days ago. He was in Ukraine, stealing a section of the algorithm from an American team.
At the Kiev Opera siege. How do you know about that?
The point is - he wasn’t on the yacht, so that’s his window.
To come back to that golden moment and have it be his last.
Everyone’s last. We have to lift the algorithm from the dead drop without Sator knowing. If he believes it’s in there, he kills himself.
And not the rest of us. Where’s the dead drop?
Knowledge divided, friend.
You’re not going to tell me?
Ignorance is our ammunition. (turns to her) But I need you back on that boat.
You have to stop him killing himself until we know that algorithm is out of the dead drop.
But if I’m caught there... and my son sees... I don’t want those moments full of anguish if they’re going to be his last.
They’re not.
The Protagonist watches the troops prepare.
Cough it up. It’s time. The Protagonist turns to face Ives.
We're working our way back to the 14th. But without knowing where the dead drop is, there’s only so much I can prepare. (no response) You need me to get you there.
Know what a hypocentre is? Ives shakes his head.

Ground zero for an underground nuclear test. Sir Michael Crosby told me about a detonation at Stalsk-12 on the 14th - the dead drop is at the bottom of the hypocentre. That explosion seals up the algorithm.
Then we'd better pull it out of that hole before the bomb goes off.

Soldiers in respirators file into the turnstile. Through proving window we see them ‘back’ into the exit... The Protagonist checks his gear at the back of the line. He s Kat watching from the airlock. He goes to her.  117.
The Protagonist pulls off his respirator.
Where’s Neil?
He must’ve already gone through...
I didn’t get to say goodbye - this is goodbye, isn’t it?
Today’s the 14th. Offshore of Siberia - time for us to go. You keep going back another day, give you time to make it to Viet Nam.
Who gets me back on the yacht?
I’ve got somebody good lined up. I'd like to say you don’t have to do this, but...
I once told you I didn’t need redemption. But the chance to save my child? You can’t know what that means to a mother.
No.

The worst thing Andrei ever did to me was that offer - to let me go if I never saw my son again. I shouted, swore — INSERT CUT: Kat FLINGS a crystal BOWL OF RASPBERRIES, SMASHING it on a wooden deck...
But he’d seen it on my face - just for an instant. Kat looks at the Protagonist. Who says nothing.
I don’t know if I hate him more for the things he’s done, or because he knows that about me. You’ve killed people you hated before?  118.
It’s not usually personal.
He’s dying, anyway. It might not even count -—

It always counts. You’re not there to kill him - you’re the backstop. If we haven't lifted that algorithm and he kills himself, he takes us all with him, instantly. Kat moves to the Protagonist, in close -
Just keep up your end, okay? The Protagonist nods. She kisses him.
When it’s over, and you’re raising your boy. Carry this - The Protagonist hands her a DUMB PHONE.
There may be a time and place you feel threatened. Hit talk, state your location, hang up.
Who gets the message?
Posterity.
The Protagonist watches the icebreaker recede...

location: VAST BARREN PLAIN, DUSTED WITH SNOW

text: Three CHINOOKS zoom low across the barren landscape, foll by another three CHINOOKS long-lining SHIPPING CONTAINERS

The Protagonist sits amongst a DOZEN SOLDIERS. They watch endless northern plain unroll beneath them...  119. EXT. TENET CAMP — CONTINUOUS The Protagonist gets off the Chinook, watching another Chinook gently set down a container. He follows the other a tent.

Soldiers in folding chairs facing a screen. The Protagoni looks around - still no Neil. Ives steps up, signals for projector: a devastated CITY, grey CONCRETE and ABANDONED industry amongst terraced strip mines...

Stalsk-12. Hidden from the world. A city where anything can happen, and today, gentlemen, for ten minutes, it most assuredly does. Ives switches to a GRAPHIC: a childishly simple diagram o LANDING AREA, BUILDINGS, then an UNDERGROUND CAVERN...

You were divided into two teams for a temporal pincer movement. We are Red team, moving forwards. Our friends out there - (gestures at containers) - Blue team, led by Commander Wheeler, are inverted. One hour from now, they had this briefing... INSERT CUT: Neil, in RESPIRATOR, in the front row of Commander Wheeler’s briefing of BLUE TEAM. All are in respirators...

Then were dropped on the ridge above the hypocentre as close in time to the detonation as possible. Their objectives were clearance and clarification. This briefing has the benefit of their experience - and yes, some of you specialists are on both teams. The Protagonist overhears -—
Why don’t they let us see them?
Maybe we won’t like what happened.  120.

A SPEEDBOAT bounces through the chop, Mahir (from the freeport heist) at the helm. Kat, beside him, shields her eyes from the glare as they head towards Sator’s yacht. T pull up some way off. A chopper sits on the yacht. Mahir hands Kat binoculars - Kat watches her EARLIER SELF HER SON board the tender and head for shore...
Ives gestures across the whole area on the schematic -

The entire area is radioactive, so both teams wear full protection. To distinguish teams, wear these - A soldier starts passing out RED ARMBANDS... INSERT CUT: Neil, in respirator, takes a BLUE ARMBAND, an like the rest of the team, puts it on...
Ives points to each of the three elements in turn:

Landing zone, LZ, well defended, including ground-to-air ordinance. We drop in, clear the LZ for Blue team’s evacuation... We make our way into the city proper... these buildings are abandoned, but we learned they have a turnstile in this one... so expect a bi-temporal response.
They’1l have inverse ordinance?
Inverse, conventional, forwards antagonists, inverted antagonists - they have it all, and it can all end you. Got it? Ives goes back to the diagram -
On the other side of the city, the ground rises to the ridge above the hypocentre. yP (MORE )  121.

Most of you will proceed up the hill - a splinter unit will take a tunnel from the city to the floor of the hypocentre. Blue team located an entrance here - Ives points to the city’s edge. Then to the CAVERN.
The bomb is in the rock high above to trigger a collapse, sealing the cavern.
How do we defuse the bomb up there?

We don’t. The explosion takes place as planned, exactly ten minutes after our landing. Everything is synchronized to that explosion. Both teams have countdown watches - ours counts down from ten at landing, to zero at the explosion. He holds up his wrist to display a BLOOD-RED ‘10’ -
Blue team is the reverse - INSERT CUT: a PREVIOUS BRIEFING (BLUE TEAM). NEIL watches Wheeler holds up her wrist to show a VIVID-BLUE ‘10’ -
Ten at the explosion, to zero at our extraction. If you are not at the LZ by zero, you are not leaving.
Our job is to fail to defuse the bomb, while the splinter unit achieves its task undetected.
Which is?
Need to know. And you don’t. Any other stupid questions? Right, let’s get ready. Everybody RISES. The Protagonist approaches Ives.
I wanted to be on the first wave.  122.

There is no first wave - Red team and Blue team operate simultaneously. Do not get on the chopper if you can’t stop thinking in linear terms. You want to be on the team who lifts the contents of that capsule?
Absolutely.
That's us. We're the splinter unit.
Just us?
No one who knows the contents of that capsule can leave the field. I thought we’d manage ourselves.
Mahir shows Kat how to use a small pistol. Kat wears a tw piece bathing suit with a shirt over. He puts the pistol diver’s bag, loops the lanyard round Kat’s bare ankle.
It's forty feet from the private deck to the water. Can you jump it?
I can dive it. They hear the chopper SPIN UP. Mahir shows her a FLARE GU
Until you see my signal, you don’t let him die. Kat nods. The chopper lifts off and ZOOMS overhead. Mahir guns the powerboat, STREAKING towards the yacht...
The Soldiers head for the Chinooks. As they pass the containers, some stare at them... the Chinooks lift off, Chinooks rise, LIFTING the containers...
Mahir pulls up fifty yards from the stern of Sator’s yach Kat grabs the pistol bag and slips into the water...  123.

The Chinooks BEAT LOW over the windswept plain. Stalsk-12 appears on the horizon - terraced strip-mined land leadin a set of CONCRETESTRUCTURES FUSED TO THE EARTH... EXT. SATOR’S YACHT, COAST OF VIET NAM - DAY Kat quietly pulls herself out of the water and onto a rea platform. She STEALTHILY makes her way up through the boa

The Chinooks long-lining containers RISE, slowing, as the other Chinooks BARREL in towards a large flat area - ANTI AIRCRAFT GUNS start FIRING... The Protagonist grabs his gun and LEAPS from the Chinook it hovers close to the ground...
The Chinooks long-lining containers fly BACKWARDS towards giant DEPRESSION...
Neil looks out a peephole -
We’re coming in on the shock wave... hang on, people! - Neil GRABS his belts as WHUMMMMM!!!! The container SHUDDE
The SHOCK WAVE CONTRACTS - the Chinook ‘SURFING’ backward on the shock as it approaches the hypocentre... ENERGY BUILDING... GROUND LIFTING AND FLATTENING...

The Protagonist joins a unit of Red team soldiers who CHA an antiaircraft emplacement TAKING IT OUT BEFORE IT CAN F ON THE SLOW-MOVING CHINOOKS... The Protagonist uses his assault rifle to take out a gunemplacement. Ives uses an inverse grenade to violently ‘reassemble’ an enemy gun emplacement out of existence, shredding the enemy with reverse shrapnel...  124.

Draw them back into the city, away from Blue team... The Chinooks drop down, land the containers - the Protago looks back to see, a hundred metres away, the containers - Blue team ‘SCRAMBLING’ BACKWARDS from the containers... SOME CARRY INJURED COMRADES, ALL SEEM EXHAUSTED... The Protagonist and Red team press forward, blasting at t remaining enemy troops who run for the cover of the city. the Protagonist checks his watch - a BRIGHT-RED ‘9:59’, ‘9:58’...

The reverse explosion PEAKS. SUDDEN CALM as the Chinooks place the containers down - they open and Blue team runs ‘FORWARDS’, Neil at the head, guns raised, BLASTING at the ENEMY SOLDIERS on ridge... Neil checks his watch - a BRIGHT-BLUE ‘9:57’, ‘9:56’... he turns to see a GREY TRUCK ‘REVERSING’ toward the hole, tyres sucking up dust... a rope from its rear h TAUT into the hole... BANG! BANG! SHOTS are sucked out of the ground around him Blue team FORCES the enemy away from the hole, towards Re team (whose members fight ‘backwards’) - Neil shouts to Wheeler -

Draw their fire! Pull them away... He RACES down the ridge, following Wheeler... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Kat comes out to find a JUNIOR CREW MEMBER cleaning up a SMASHED BOWL OF RASPBERRIES. He looks up at her, surprise
Ma’am? We thought you’d gone ashore.
I snuck back to surprise Andrei.
The Boss left... He trails off - they hear an INCOMING CHOPPER.  125.
I’ll get the mess. Have Mr Sator find me here. Don’t tell the others. The Junior Crew Member nods, leaves - Kat moves to the RA checks Mahir in the distance, the DAYBED, the water HOSE.

The Protagonist, Ives and Red team head towards the large concrete turnstile building on the outskirts of the city The Protagonist sees Wheeler running backwards towards a BUNKER on their right which UNEXPLODES - - GUNFIRE CRACKLES around them, pinning them down... They hit the bunker with an RPG, then race around the lef the turnstile building...
Wheeler leads Blue team down the hill - ‘chasing’ the ene who run BACKWARDS - a BLUE TEAM member TRIGGERS A LANDMIN another triggers an INVERSE LANDMINE -

Hit the deck! Mines! As Blue team goes to the ground, Neil sees mines start to EXPLODE/IMPLODE in a wave towards him as the GREY TRUCK R BACKWARDS down the hill through the minefield, REVERSE- TRIGGERING THE MINES - Neil DIVES out of the way, almost over... Then gets up to follow the ‘path’ of the grey truck... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Kat unzips the diver’s bag, feels the handle of the gun, slides the bag under the daybed, checking she can reach. moves to the rail, crouches to UNCLIP the bottom safety cable. She looks at Mahir’s boat across the water...

Ives leads Red team into the deserted concrete structures an efficient cover-and-move formation... the Protagonist shelters behind LARGE CONCRETE CHUNKS. Which VIBRATE... GATHERING ENERGY...  126. The Protagonist JUMPS AWAY as the chunks RIP FROM THE GRO

head_text.subj: BOUNCING VIOLENTLY, DUSTILY OFF EACH OTHER AND FLYING UP

text: A GAP IN THE SIDE OF A BUILDING as an INVERSE RPG ZIPS ba up into a WINDOW - Ives has spotted the window and calls for an RPG to ‘foll the inverse one, BLASTING the building... the Protagonist checks his watch - ‘8:10’, ‘8:09’...

Neil checks his watch - ‘8:08’, ‘8:07’... he heads downhi towards the city, where the rest of Blue team BEAT BACK t enemy... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Kat hoses the raspberries and glass from the deck... Sato appears, watching as she turns the water on herself.
They told me you’d gone ashore.
They told me you’d flown off.
I came back. To see you and Max.
Max is on shore with Anna. We need time, just you and me. After what -
I was joking. A stupid joke -
You think I’m a terrible mother.
We both know my opinion of you is higher than yours of me.
I want things to be better, Andrei. She moves towards him. Sator nods. Picks up the phone -
Have the captain turn the boat so we'll see the sunset from here.  127.
The Protagonist RUNS across the street, FIRING at the enemy... he SPOTS the TUNNEL ENTRANCE between two buildin
Ives! Splinter unit here! Ives nods. RACES over, drawing fire the whole way...

Neil races into the city streets... he sees Commander Whe and a BLUE SOLDIER take shelter in a large jagged BREACH the ground-floor wall of a massive structure. Neil is FORCED to hit the deck, ducking INVERTED fire all around... he looks over at Wheeler, and sees DUST GATHERI AROUND THE BREACH...

Wheeler! Get out of there! Wheeler! Wheeler hears him - tries to grab the Blue Soldier - MASS CHUNKS OF CONCRETE SCRAPE OVER NEIL’S HEAD, FLYING TOWARD WHEELER, who DIVES CLEAR - the wall REASSEMBLES ON TOP OF Blue Soldier, CRUSHING HIM... Neil winces. Starts crawling for better cover... checks h watch - ‘6:24','’6:23’... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Sator looks past Kat to the lowering sun.
It’s going to be a beautiful sunset. I’1l get Max brought back - we should share the moment with him. Sator picks up the phone. Kat looks at the shore, uneasy.
Ives and the Protagonist shelter as Red team exchanges fi with the Enemy further up the street. The Protagonist che his watch - ‘5:15’, ‘5:14’...
Let’s go. We’re running out of time.  128.
If they see us, it’s all for nothing.
We need a distraction. Ives looks ahead to the LEANING RUIN OF A BUILDING TOP...
Don’t worry about that...

Neil checks his watch - ‘5:10’, ‘5:09’... frustrated, pin down, he looks around for a way to break cover... Commander Wheeler, with the rest of Blue team, SHELTERS i the shadow of the RUINED BASE of a building, pinned by EN FIRE from the base of the building...
RPG! Take out the base - on my mark She checks her watch - ‘5:04’, ‘5:03’... The BLUE RPG SOLDIER takes aim...
The Protagonist spots SMALL DEBRIS ROLLING across the street... GATHERING MOMENTUM...
Ives! Ives sees LARGER and LARGER debris is ROLLING down the st towards the LEANING RUIN OF A BUILDING TOP...
It’s about to get distracting... He signals a RED RPG SOLDIER...
On my mark! He looks at his watch - ‘5:01’, ‘5:00’ -
Fire! The leaning ruin THRUSTS UPWARDS -  129.
Wheeler watches as the Leaning Ruin’s UPPER STOREYS REASSEMBLE, as its BASE EXPLODES...

The Protagonist takes cover as the Leaning Ruin’s BASE REASSEMBLES as its UPPER STOREYS EXPLODE... the Protagoni and Ives race at the tunnel entrance - the GREY TRUCK RAC at them as they dive for the tunnel...
Wheeler ducks as the weight of the upper storeys COLLAPSE the building... Neil lifts his head after the EXPLO/IMPLOSION. Clear. He up and starts RUNNING...
The Protagonist and Ives RACE into the tunnel, HITTING A

head_text.subj: TRIPWIRE WHICH BLOWS THE TUNNEL ENTRANCE DOWN BEHIND THEM

text: EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Sator hangs up. He holds a SILVER PILL in the sunlight, studying it...
What’s that?
I borrowed it from the CIA.
But what is it?
The way the world ends, not with a bang but a whimper.
I don’t understand.
When I take this, it’s all over.
Then don’t take it, yet. Sator looks at her, needing her to care.  130.
Why not?
We've got the sunset coming and a little vodka left...
And Max will be here soon... they thought it was you, not Anna, on shore with Max. Kat steps up in front of Sator, seductive...
As long as you can tell the difference... Sator smiles appreciatively, but pulls out his phone -
A moment’s business, my love... EXT. MAHIR’S BOAT - CONTINUOUS Mahir checks his radio -
(over radio) Not clear. Repeat, not clear...
The Protagonist and Ives look back at the COLLAPSED ENTRA
We’re committed now. They turn and RACE through the mining tunnel...
(into radio) Just hold tight - we’re almost there...

Neil spots SATOR’S GREY MI8 OVERHEAD, a rope hanging down Across the street he sees VOLKOV REVERSE-EXIT the tunnel mouth, CROUCHING to ‘DERIG’ a tripwired booby trap, carry it towards the chopper, then LEAPING up onto the line - RISING from the streets...  131. Neil STARES. CONCERNED. Checks his watch - ‘4:10’, ‘4:09’ Then TAKES OFF, SPRINTING -
Neil! She watches him go ahead, then signals Blue team to keep pushing forward...

The Protagonist and Ives run down the tunnel... they slow they see a BODY, blue armband, lying on the ground on the opposite side of a SET OF BARS at the end of the tunnel. They can see into the hypocentre, the GIANT ATOMIC-HEWN CAVERN, daylight above, CAPSULE on the rock floor next to mouth of a BORE HOLE. The Protagonist checks his watch - ‘4:06’, ‘4:05’ ... Ives checks the ELECTRONIC LOCK -

We don’t have anything big enough to blow this. Try him - The Protagonist reaches through the bars and checks the b - FREEZES: attached to a zip, a TALISMAN - A COIN WITH A HANGING FROM A SMALL LENGTH OF ORANGE AND YELLOW STRING.. The Protagonist looks at it, quizzical, rises -
Nothing. Can you pick it?

I hope not. I paid a lot for that lock... WHAM! Ives goes down - SHOT BY VOLKOV, bullet SPARKING of his helmet - on the other side of the bars - gun pointed the Protagonist, FIELD RADIO held out... Sator’s voice EC through the tunnel -
(over phone) How do you like where my journey began, and yours ends? Volkov takes the Protagonist’s gun. Forces him to push Iv gun through the bars.

A little radioactive for my taste. Volkov drops the guns into the water, places the radio by bars...  132. EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Sator steps away from Kat as he speaks quietly into the phone.

My fate was always bound up with radiation. We’d work where no one else would. We made a devil’s bargain - money for time. We sold our futures. Kat looks at Mahir’s boat. Nothing. She looks to the shor Far in the distance, she can see the TENDER APPROACHING..
The Protagonist looks at Volkov. At the bars between him the capsule...
Now you’re making the same mistake for the entire world.

(over phone) It wasn’t a mistake. I made the bargain I could. What was yours? You fight for a cause you barely understand. With people you trust so little you’ve told them nothing about what you’re doing. When I die the world dies with me. And your knowledge dies with you. Buried in the tomb like an anonymous Egyptian builder sealed in the pyramid to keep his secret...

Neil comes into the turnstile room... he watches ENEMY TR enter/exit the machine, inverting to join the battle. He waits for his chance... the room is empty... he sees hims through the proving window, and RUNS at the machine... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - EVENING Sator speaks into his phone -
Your faith is blind. You’re a fanatic.  133.
(over phone) What’s more fanatical than trying to destroy the world? Kat moves towards Sator, but he raises a finger...

I’m not. I’m creating a new one. Somewhere, sometime, a man ina crystalline tower throws a switch and Armageddon is both triggered and avoided. Entropy inverts the same way the magnetic poles have switched 183 times over the millennia. Now time itself switches direction. Sator looks out at the lowering sun...
The same sunshine we’ve basked in will warm the faces of our descendants generations from now. Kat looks at Mahir’s boat. Nothing. She looks to shore, watching the TENDER APPROACHING...
The Protagonist looks at his watch - ‘2:12’, ‘2:11’...
How can they want to destroy us?

(over phone) Because their oceans rose and their rivers ran dry. Don’t you see -? Their world shrivelled because of us. They have no choice but to turn back, there’s no life ahead of them. And we’re responsible. Knowing this, do you still want me to stop?
Yes. Each generation looks out for its own survival. EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Sator looks out at the glittering water -
That’s exactly what they’re doing.  134.
(over phone) Sure, but not you. You’re a traitor. Bringing death to all because you have no life of your own left.
When I’m done, life continues.
(over phone) Not your son’s.
My greatest sin was to bring a son into a world I knew was ending... do you think God will forgive me?
(over phone) For killing your son? No.
He should understand - he killed his own.
Neil, FORWARDS NOW, spots a GREY TRUCK outside the turnst building - he jumps in, FIRING IT UP -

head_text.subj: RACING THROUGH THE STREETS, PAST THE IMPLODING/ EXPLODING

text: BUILDING, racing for the tunnel mouth, trying to head off Protagonist and Ives -
Wait! Wait! They dive into the tunnel, which COLLAPSES. Neil sets his sights on the hypocentre ridge above, GUNS the engine...
Wheeler leads Blue team towards the CHINOOKS LOWERING CONTAINERS... as they carry their wounded and lurch towar the containers, they see Red team ‘REASSEMBLING’ the anti aircraft guns...
The Protagonist watches Volkov pick up a BLACK, METAL, GEOMETRICALLY COMPLEX BAR... the algorithm.  135.
You don’t believe in God. Or a new future. Or anything outside your own experience.
(over phone) That’s all any of us knows. The rest is belief, and I don’t have it.
Without it you’re not human. You’re a madman.
(over phone) Or a god of sorts.

Like I said. Volkov slowly backs towards the capsule with the algorith The Protagonist looks down at Ives - whose hand is MOVING EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS A BEEP. Sator checks his watch.
Our time is up. He looks across at Kat standing by the rail.
I‘1l give my wife your love.
(over phone) You're forgetting, I haven’t met her, yet.
That's right, after you meet her, she dies. I’1l just give her my love, instead.

Volkov seals the capsule - hooks it to a winch... the Protagonist watches Ives’s hand emerge with a SIDEARM... Volkov raises the capsule up over the mouth of the DEEP B HOLE, then steps back, preparing to release the winch and drop the capsule into the well...  136. EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - SUNSET Sator goes to hang up, pauses... an afterthought -
Volkov?
Volkov RUSHES FORWARD with his gun...

(over phone; in Russian, subtitled) - Shoot him in the head. - Volkov PULLS HIS TRIGGER - but the Dead Tenet Soldier has ‘RISEN’ to be in front of the gun ‘ABSORBING’ the bullet then LEAPING to one side, ALIVE - EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Sator hears the shot, SATISFIED - Kat pulls the phone awa
Enough business, Andrei...
The Protagonist DIVES to where Ives is lying, GRABS his g Volkov TURNS, RUNNING FOR the winch-release -
He FIRES at Volkov, who goes down just short of the winch Ives struggles to his feet, checking his watch - ‘1:07’, 41:06’... Hearing BEEPS, Ives looks up. THE LOCK is open -

Neil RACES up the slope to the ridge - through the MINEFI setting off personnel mines in his wake, NARROWLY AVOIDIN RUNNING HIMSELF OVER... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - EVENING As Kat pours him a drink, Sator looks out at the glowing horizon, fiddling with the silver pill... he POINTS -  137.

Tomorrow the sun will rise in that same spot. For the first time in history. Because I’ve told it to. (looks at her like she’s a loyal dog) You have no idea what I’m talking about, do you? She looks at him, smiles sweetly.
It sounds terribly important, Andrei. He reaches for her - she gets up, moves to the rail -
Where’re you going? She grabs the hose, starts spraying herself -
Aren’t you hot? Kat sprays the deck in front of the rail -
What’re you doing, now?
I spilled sunscreen.
So what?
It's slippery.
Just come here... She looks at Sator lying on the daybed like an appalling emperor. Moves towards him. Grabs the sunscreen.
Turn over.
The sun’s almost gone.

You'll like it. He rolls over, obedient. She squirts a large dollop acros his back. Looks up at Mahir’s boat, hopeful. Nothing.  138. She checks her watch as she lazily smears the sunscreen across Sator’s back. He groans. Kat watches the TENDER APPROACHING, she can just make out HERSELF AND HER SON...
The Protagonist watches the Dead Tenet Soldier RACING BACKWARDS from the gate, out of the tunnel -
The Protagonist TURNS - Ives swings the gate open - they through, just before it closes, SLAMMING SHUT behind them
Tunnel’s sealed! The Protagonist steps over Volkov, STRUGGLES with the capsule, it swings, HANGING precariously over the well...
(into radio) Mahir, do you copy? EXT. MAHIR’S BOAT - EVENING Mahir looks through binoculars, FRUSTRATED, flare gun rea
(over radio) Hold! Repeat, hold!

Neil REVERSES towards the hole - jumps out, pulling a lin from the rear winch... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - SUNSET Kat looks at Mahir’s boat. Nothing. She checks her watch. looks down at the tender approaching - it’s close enough can clearly see HERSELF CHATTING AND LAUGHING WITH MAX... jumps up from the daybed, holding the diver’s bag. Sator looks up at her, surprised.
I can’t do this.
Don’t spoil this moment, Kat.
I can’t let you think you’ve won...  139. Sator looks at her, suddenly wary...
What are you talking about, Katherine?
I’m not letting you go to your grave thinking we’re all coming with you. I can’t give you that - She pulls out the SILENCED PISTOL. He is UTTERLY UNAFRAID
You're dying alone, Andrei.
(contemptuous ) No, I’m not.
Andrei, look in my eyes. Which do you see, despair... or anger?
What?
I’m not the woman who could find love for you even though you’d scarred her on the inside... Kat pulls up her shirt to reveal the MASSIVE, ANGRY SCAR
I’m the vengeful bitch you scarred on the outside. Sator realizes he’s been conned - LUNGES FOR HER -
You -! KAT SHOOTS HIM IN THE UPPER CHEST - his hands go to his c - he GASPS, air leaking from his lungs... Kat ROLLS Sator the daybed onto his back - he GURGLES - she GRABS his leg

head_text.subj: SLIDES HIM AT THE GAP BELOW THE RAIL -

text: Sator SHOOTS off the deck, TUMBLING DOWN to the sea - his head CRACKS on the rear platform as he HITS the water - EXT. MAHIR’S BOAT - CONTINUOUS Mahir lowers his binoculars, STARTLED, as he sees Sator’s body pitch into the sea -  140.
(into radio) She’s killed him! She’s killed him! Mahir GUNS the engine, racing towards the yacht...
The Protagonist opens the capsule, revealing the algorith
She jumped the gun - she killed him! The Protagonist looks at Ives, ashen - A LINE DROPS BETWE THEM —

Neil is at the wheel of the truck. Through the rear-view mirror he looks at his line running into the hole. Throug the windshield he watches Red and Blue soldiers finish loading and LIFT OFF. He checks his watch - ‘00:09’, ‘00:08’...
Fuck it - He GUNS it, PULLING AWAY FROM THE HOLE -

The Protagonist and Ives are YANKED into the air, the Protagonist CLUTCHING the algorithm - as they approach th rocky edge of the hole, Ives raises his boots to cushion - IMPACT! They BOUNCE PAINFULLY over the lip -

The truck DRAGS them along the rocky ground, away from th hole as... BOOOOM!!!! THE ROCKY GROUND BUCKLES WITH FORCE SMOKE and FLAMES BLAST up out of the hole in an ANGRY PLU The ground around the hole COLLAPSES IN AN EVER-GROWING

The line SNAPS, leaving the Protagonist and Ives TUMBLING a stop... The SUBSIDENCE approaches, SLOWING, SLOWING... ground OPENS UP under the Protagonist - Ives GRABS HIM - Protagonist has the algorithm in his hands, Ives PULLS hi back onto solid ground...  141.
Wheeler PULLS a last Blue team soldier into the container her watch hits ZERO - the container door SLAMS shut -

Do you think they made it? EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - SUNSET Kat picks up the shell casing, drops it in the diver’s ba zips it up, attaches the lanyard to her ankle, sprays dow the deck, WASHING away BLOOD and SUNSCREEN... Kat steps up to the railing. Watches Mahir, down below, getting a line on Sator’s body. Kat glances over at the TENDER ARRIVING WITH HER EARLIER SELF AND HER SON... Kat DIVES, ARCING GRACEFULLY THROUGH THE SUNSET... Kat's earlier self, stepping onto the yacht, catches a glimpse of a graceful form SLICING into the water. She lo CURIOUS, but Max TUGS her sleeve and she turns. EXT. COAST OF VIET NAM -— CONTINUOUS On Mahir’s SPEEDING boat, Kat hands Mahir the diver’s bag looks up ahead to the last light of day...
(over radio) Kat, you jumped the gun! Mahir hands her the radio -
I couldn’t do it, I couldn’t let him die thinking he’d won. And I knew you’d find a way. Silence. She glances Mahir, suddenly concerned -
Wait, you found a way? We're okay, right?
(over radio) Yeah. We found a way. Be safe. Mahir’s boat SPEEDS AWAY through the twilight... ...DRAGGING Sator’s body behind.  142.

A Chinook swirls snow around the blasted ruins... Ives an the Protagonist slump, bruised, exhausted, gas masks off, breathing hard. On the ground between them - the matte-bl algorithm... Neil approaches, removing his gas mask...
I thought you were inverted.
Changed gears halfway - you needed help here.
We needed help down there. (to Protagonist) How’d you get that lock open?
It wasn’t me. (to Neil) Didn’t your team need you?
I'll get them on the next pass. Right, Ives?

Once I’ve caught my breath. The Protagonist reaches for the algorithm - Ives PULLS it of his reach - his gun laying casually across his leg. As Neil and the Protagonist watch, Ives takes his weapon in hand, gets to his feet... He lifts the algorithm... looks around at the deserted plain above Stalsk-12...
Nice and private. Ives SEPARATES the algorithm into THREE COMPONENTS -
No one who’s seen this leaves the field...
We hide it, we end our lives. It’s the only way to be sure. Ives TOSSES them each one component...
But as to when... Ives HOLSTERS his sidearm.  143.
Maybe that’s every man’s decision to make for himself.
You’re not going to kill us?
If I ever find you I will.
But you won’t look too hard.
Yes, I will. Neil shakes his head, smiling at this. Ives heads towards Chinook. Neil and the Protagonist watch him go...
You’re not heading back to London to check on Kat, are you?
Of course not. That would be too dangerous.
Even from afar.
Even from afar. Neil thinks of something. Looks at Ives -
Ives, wait! Neil takes his section of the algorithm, REATTACHES it to Protagonist’s.
You’re really going back in?
I’m the only one who could’ve got that door open in time, right Ives? Ives looks at Neil, sizing him up.
I don’t have any locksmiths as good as you. Neil turns to the Protagonist, grabs his BACKPACK...  144.

See? That's me in there, again. Weaving another pass in the fabric of this mission. Neil SWINGS his pack onto his back, revealing a TALISMAN COIN WITH A HOLE TIED to the zip WITH ORANGE AND YELLOW THREAD —
Neil, wait.
We just saved the world - we can’t leave anything to chance. The Protagonist thinks. Struggles.
But can we change things? If we do it differently...? Neil looks back at the Protagonist. Sees his struggle...
What’s happened’s happened. (smiles) Which is an expression of faith in the mechanics of the world, not an excuse to do nothing.
Fate?
Call it what you want.
What do you call it?
Reality. Now let me go. The Protagonist lets him walk, tears welling up... CALLS
Hey! (Neil turns) You never did tell me who recruited you.
(smiles) Haven't you guessed by now? You did. Just not when you thought. You have a future in the past. Years ago for me. Years from now for you.  145.
You’ve known me for years?
(nods ) For me, I think this is the end of a beautiful friendship.
But for me it’s just the beginning?
And we get up to some stuff. You’re gonna love it. You’ll see. This whole operation is a temporal pincer.
Whose?
Yours. You’re only halfway there. I’'1l see you at the beginning, friend. Neil turns. Follows Ives to board the Chinook. The Protagonist watches him go...
We're the people saving the world from what might have been... The Protagonist looks down at the algorithm in his hands.
The world will never know what could've happened... He pulls up his collar and walks into the snow...
Kat is walking up the road to the school gates.
.--and even if they did they wouldn’t care... She feels something wrong. Looking across the road, she s a car with tinted windows shadowing her.
...because no one cares about the bomb that didn’t go off... She gets out the dumb phone the Protagonist had given her  146.
..+.jJust the one that did...
Priya is in the front passenger seat. The DRIVER next to has a GUN and SILENCER sitting on his knee...
Do it before the boy comes out. The rear door opens - a dull thud - the Driver is SHOT by silenced pistol -
That’s your idea of mercy? Priya turns - the Protagonist has a gun to the back of he seat.
You gave me your word.
And I told you what it would be worth. Here. Today. How did you know? He holds up a dumb phone, plays a voicemail -
(via recording) Cannon Place, 3 o’clock, it’s -
Posterity.
Kat hits send, speaks into the phone -
Cannon Place, 3 o’clock, it’s probably nothing...
The Protagonist watches Kat.
I told you you’d have to start looking differently at the world.
I have to tie up the loose ends.  147.
That was never your job.
Then whose was it? The Protagonist brings his focus back to Priya.
Mine. I realized I wasn’t working for you. We’ve both been working for me... I’m the protagonist.
Then you’d better tie up those loose ends. He shoots her through the seat back. She slumps forward.
Mission accomplished. The Protagonist looks across the road. The kids stream ou Kat sees Max coming, takes one last look at the dark car.
.--but it’s the bomb that didn’t go off... Kat shakes her head, smiling at her own folly, looks at t phone like it’s silly -
...the danger no one knew was real... She tosses the phone carelessly into her bag.
That’s the bomb with the real power to change the world. The Protagonist watches Kat and Max walk away. Max offers his hand and we - FADE OUT. CREDITS. END.
